commit_message:
Add state check when suspend or resume stack

If suspend a stack which is already suspended,
some resource will throw exceptions.and you can't
suspend or resume that failed resource.

Add stack check when update or resume,if the
state of stack is expecter,return directly.

Change-Id: Ie6859c03168d9d18e88bbeb6df2c646541f2aa9d
Closes-Bug: 1284531

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary calls to self.config()

tests.TestCase:setUp calls self.config(), so there's no need to call
it again.

Change-Id: I02d460d5b0fa7b885f1134198c3215bc69649461

commit_message:
Increases timeout for guest agent resize_fs

When the guest agent resizes the file system, it may take longer
than the AGENT_LOW_TIMEOUT and should use AGENT_HIGH_TIMEOUT to
ensure the resize has sufficient time to complete.

Change-Id: Ic3c030f60ca47d894eb25b83f05b63ef22d519f8
Closes-Bug: #1288766

subject: Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-11 00:35:37.000000000', 'files': ['heat/db/sqlalchemy/api.py', 'heat/tests/test_sqlalchemy_api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/81b8d45b334743dfd0b27dae3b21e2134d79bb08', 'message': "Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name

stack_get compares the context tenant to the stack tenant
and the stack_user_project_id. stack_get_by_name only filters
by tenant, so identify_stack fails when looking up by stack name
and the stack_user_project_id is the context tenant (such as when
there is a cfn API describe resource call).

This change searches for tenant or stack_user_project_id for
stack_get_by_name and stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id. It also
extends the tests to ensure a stack is returned when
stack_user_project_id matches, and no stack is returned when
tenant doesn't match.

Closes-Bug: #1288523
Change-Id: I875e232a791c71a4ad55a0e4e5a1423ec3546119
"}]
commit_message:
Account for stack_user_project_id in stack_get_by_name

stack_get compares the context tenant to the stack tenant
and the stack_user_project_id. stack_get_by_name only filters
by tenant, so identify_stack fails when looking up by stack name
and the stack_user_project_id is the context tenant (such as when
there is a cfn API describe resource call).

This change searches for tenant or stack_user_project_id for
stack_get_by_name and stack_get_by_name_and_owner_id. It also
extends the tests to ensure a stack is returned when
stack_user_project_id matches, and no stack is returned when
tenant doesn't match.

Closes-Bug: #1288523
Change-Id: I875e232a791c71a4ad55a0e4e5a1423ec3546119
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/96/79496/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: def _setup_test_stack(self, stack_name, stack_id=None, owner_id=None): owner_id=owner_id) stack = self._setup_test_stack('stack', UUID1)[1] stack1 = self._setup_test_stack('stack1', UUID1)[1] owner_id=stack1.id)[1]

commit_message:
Call an existing method in sync cache for revoke events

The cache used for synchronizing the revocation tree across
green threads had an issue where it was calling a non-existant
method ``remove`` instead of ``remove_event``. The correct method
is now being called and an expanded test to exercise the synchronize
method has been added.

Change-Id: I3fe47fa51f88aab89480831b2d95746319f82ceb
Closes-Bug: 1289935
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/74/79174/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db module

Changes -
 * db: move all options into database group
 * Make TRADITIONAL the default SQL mode
 * Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
 * Mark files graduating to oslotest
 * Fix a small typo in api.py
 * Update oslo log messages with translation domains

Change-Id: I3af511bbbc2565c5748d1f47d29cd1c5047d3e26

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator db.sqlalchemy module

Changes -
 * Add from_config() method to EngineFacade
 * Introduce mysql_sql_mode option, remove old warning
 * Introduce a method to set any MySQL session SQL mode
 * Handle ibm_db_sa DBDuplicateEntry integrity errors
 * Fix migration.db_version when no tables
 * Update log translation domains
 * Add model_query() to db.sqlalchemy.utils module
 * Remove None for dict.get()
 * Fix duplicating of SQL queries in logs
 * Update oslo log messages with translation domains

Change-Id: I654acad217e552e64283e93ef884d5cd8dea58da

let global requirements update happen again

this broke the way the gate was functioning, we can unwind the
developer case later, but this behavior is needed.

Change-Id: I41115f70b9157d1dcbfed24c720172b3184780e0

added_lines: (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR; \ $SUDO_CMD python update.py $project_dir)
deleted_lines: # Don't update repo if local changes exist # Don't use buggy "git diff --quiet" # ``errexit`` requires us to trap the exit code when the repo is changed local update_requirements=$(cd $project_dir && git diff --exit-code >/dev/null || echo "changed") if [[ $update_requirements = "changed" ]]; then (cd $REQUIREMENTS_DIR; \ $SUDO_CMD python update.py $project_dir) fi

commit_message:
Show the service id for service-list command

Current service-list command does not show each service id.
Nova contains a RESTful API to delete a service with the specified id.
This patch adds the service id column to use the id in the above case.

Change-Id: I616573c6d5b7e922a6c79d92752a19f65cca00d5

commit_message:
Use multiprocessing in UserGenerator for creating tenants and users.

Create each tenant and its users in separate process to save performance.

Notes:
  * single keystone client is used for each process
  * tenants IDs and users IDs are saved in UserGenerator instance instead of their instances,
    to avoid keystone client manager issue (recursion is caused by keystoneclient.base.Resource.__getattr__)

Blueprint conrurrent-creation-of-users

Change-Id: I484a9351c53c98a33712d19d28c651535e637e47
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/rally refs/changes/90/78590/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import multiprocessingfrom rally import consts, osclientsPATTERN_TENANT = "temp_%(run_id)s_tenant_%(iter)i" PATTERN_USER = "%(tenant_id)s_user_%(uid)d" def create_tenant_users(args): """Create tenant with users and their endpoints. This is suitable for using with multiprocessing. :param args: tuple with real arguments """ admin_endpoint, users_per_tenant, run_id, i = args client = osclients.Clients(admin_endpoint).get_keystone_client() users_ids = [] users_endpoints = [] tenant = client.tenants.create(PATTERN_TENANT % {"run_id": run_id, "iter": i}) for user_id in range(users_per_tenant): username = PATTERN_USER % {"tenant_id": tenant.id, "uid": user_id} user = client.users.create(username, "password", "%s@email.me" % username, tenant.id) users_ids.append(user.id) users_endpoints.append(endpoint.Endpoint(client.auth_url, user.name, "password", tenant.name, consts.EndpointPermission.USER)) return (tenant.id, users_ids, users_endpoints) class UserGenerator(object): def __init__(self, admin_endpoint, concurrent=50): self.concurrent = concurrent self.admin_endpoint = admin_endpoint self.users_ids = [] self.tenants_ids = [] self.endpoints = [] pool_args = [(self.admin_endpoint, users_per_tenant, run_id, i) for i in range(tenants)] pool = multiprocessing.Pool(self.concurrent) data = pool.imap(create_tenant_users, pool_args) pool.close() pool.join() for tenant_id, users_ids, users_endpoints in data: self.tenants_ids.append(tenant_id) self.users_ids += users_ids self.endpoints += users_endpoints return self.endpoints """Delete users and tenants after scenario is finished""" client = osclients.Clients(self.admin_endpoint).get_keystone_client() for user_id in self.users_ids: try: client.users.delete(user_id) except Exception: LOG.info("Failed to delete user: %s" % user_id) for tenant_id in self.tenants_ids: try: client.tenants.delete(tenant_id) except Exception: LOG.info("Failed to delete tenant: %s" % tenant_id)
deleted_lines: from rally import consts class UserGenerator(base.Context): def __init__(self, admin_endpoints): self.users = [] self.tenants = [] self.keystone_client = \ utils.create_openstack_clients(admin_endpoints)["keystone"] auth_url = self.keystone_client.auth_url self.tenants = [self._create_tenant(run_id, i) for i in range(tenants)] self.users = [] endpoints = [] for tenant in self.tenants: for user_id in range(users_per_tenant): user = self._create_user(user_id, tenant.id) self.users.append(user) endpoints.append(endpoint.Endpoint( auth_url, user.name, "password", tenant.name, consts.EndpointPermission.USER)) return endpoints for user in self.users: try: user.delete() except Exception: LOG.info("Failed to delete user: %s" % user.name) for tenant in self.tenants: try: tenant.delete() except Exception: LOG.info("Failed to delete tenant: %s" % tenant.name)

commit_message:
Ensure localcontext can be monkeypatched

_STORE must be instanciated at first use, not at module loading time,
to ensure eventlet can monkeypatch the threading module before the
creation of the threading.local() object

Closes-bug: #1288878

Change-Id: Iea34a28463e91aeba125d8742c4b886fa84a3c35
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.messaging refs/changes/74/78674/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import loggingLOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) _STORE = None def _ensure_store(): global _STORE if not _STORE: _STORE = threading.local() _ensure_store() _ensure_store() _ensure_store()

commit_message:
Fixed _error_checker in rest client

Restclient's method '_error_checker' for response codes 500 and 501 gets key
error exception when 'resp_body' is a string and passes conditions for
containing of keys.
Also added fix to rarely raised Exceptions after separation main and base
exceptions for two modules.

Closes-Bug: #1280767
Closes-Bug: #1289190
Partially-implements: bp unit-tests
Change-Id: I4b909d008940f8a96efc922daac64a086819c78a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/75/76475/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class TestRestClientErrorCheckerJSON(base.TestCase): c_type = "application/json" def set_data(self, r_code, enc=None, r_body=None): if enc is None: enc = self.c_type resp_dict = {'status': r_code, 'content-type': enc} resp = httplib2.Response(resp_dict) data = { "method": "fake_method", "url": "fake_url", "headers": "fake_headers", "body": "fake_body", "resp": resp, "resp_body": '{"resp_body": "fake_resp_body"}', } if r_body is not None: data.update({"resp_body": r_body}) return data def setUp(self): super(TestRestClientErrorCheckerJSON, self).setUp() self.stubs.Set(config, 'TempestConfigPrivate', fake_config.FakeConfig) self.rest_client = rest_client.RestClient( fake_auth_provider.FakeAuthProvider()) def test_response_less_than_400(self): self.rest_client._error_checker(**self.set_data("399")) def test_response_400(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.BadRequest, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("400")) def test_response_401(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("401")) def test_response_403(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.Unauthorized, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("403")) def test_response_404(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.NotFound, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("404")) def test_response_409(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.Conflict, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("409")) def test_response_413(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.OverLimit, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("413")) def test_response_422(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.UnprocessableEntity, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("422")) def test_response_500_with_text(self): # _parse_resp is expected to return 'str' self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerFault, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("500")) def test_response_501_with_text(self): self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerFault, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("501")) def test_response_500_with_dict(self): r_body = '{"resp_body": {"err": "fake_resp_body"}}' self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerFault, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("500", r_body=r_body)) def test_response_501_with_dict(self): r_body = '{"resp_body": {"err": "fake_resp_body"}}' self.assertRaises(exceptions.ServerFault, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("501", r_body=r_body)) def test_response_bigger_than_400(self): # Any response code, that bigger than 400, and not in # (401, 403, 404, 409, 413, 422, 500, 501) self.assertRaises(exceptions.RestClientException, self.rest_client._error_checker, **self.set_data("402")) class TestRestClientErrorCheckerXML(TestRestClientErrorCheckerJSON): c_type = "application/xml" class TestRestClientErrorCheckerTEXT(TestRestClientErrorCheckerJSON): c_type = "text/plain"

commit_message:
Handle not found exceptions in update_floatingip_status()

Update_status may come from agent on a floating ip which was
already deleted from db - need to handle such cases properly

Change-Id: Idfa240f8dcb0a2e5c2a97b0f168bf1ba2d7dc50f
Closes-Bug: #1287049
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/32/77632/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Fix state modifying catalog tests

Some of the service catalog tests modify the global state. They should
take a copy of the dictionary before modifying it.

Change-Id: I5de52949d561322958f603022af893f087c55e03

commit_message:
Remove unused build_url function in data_utils

This commit removes build_url function in data_utils because there is no
user of this code. The using code of this function was removed at
 I1102859c871b8f16c284bdf7fba0f4346d50a63e .

Change-Id: I8989ac12f36f342ca1066cc65f7a427a83de721f
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/34/79234/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: import re import urllibfrom tempest import exceptions def build_url(host, port, api_version=None, path=None, params=None, use_ssl=False): """Build the request URL from given host, port, path and parameters.""" pattern = 'v\d\.\d' if re.match(pattern, path): message = 'Version should not be included in path.' raise exceptions.InvalidConfiguration(message=message) if use_ssl: url = "https://" + host else: url = "http://" + host if port is not None: url += ":" + port url += "/" if api_version is not None: url += api_version + "/" if path is not None: url += path if params is not None: url += "?" url += urllib.urlencode(params) return url

commit_message:
rename and fix the db_wipe command

* rename db_wipe to db_recreate
* make --repo-path an optional argument for db_wipe and use it
* add command line help strings for db_wipe

Closes-Bug: #1279734

Change-Id: I1a1d3ad56989026fb10f6c57bb479814dc51328e

subject: Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 02:48:10.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/74262ad87defbcdbb1d9e9bdd18fbef7366e51f6', 'message': 'Fix for boolean configuration parameters

Issues:
Boolean configuration parameters are treated as integers and have to
specify min(0)/max(1) values for boolean params.
If cli -> trove configuration-create configparams '{"logappend":false}',
then cli -> trove show <configuration>, would still print it as cli ->
values | {u'logappend': False}. False instead of false.
This is due to Python upcasing booleans. Expected behavior is it should
print boolean params as true/false instead of True/False.

Fixes:
This change fixes the above mentioned issues.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-10 03:55:13.000000000', 'files': ['trove/configuration/service.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/trove/commit/481018d35410feccb1a219d2028870595dd34656', 'message': 'Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans

boolean configuration-group parameters at the moment require a
min/max value of 0/1 to work around some faulty logic that is
meant to validate integer values, but instead validates integer
and boolean values.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047
'}]
commit_message:
Remove Min/Max for Configuration Group Booleans

boolean configuration-group parameters at the moment require a
min/max value of 0/1 to work around some faulty logic that is
meant to validate integer values, but instead validates integer
and boolean values.

Closes-Bug: #1288507
Change-Id: I2d7556621e891b22291c7ef9e9c523e1ce98a047
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/99/78499/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

Refaftor get_nailgun_node_by_devops_node method

It should use mac address of a physical interface for matching
devops node to nailgun node.

commit_message:
Fix context serialization in Execution.create

Proper serialization for context passed as dict.

Also:
 * fix type casting in Exception message

Change-Id: I3ad26ebba52ae9ed55c8f56b774f5017dcbd83ff
Closes-Bug: #1290214
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-mistralclient refs/changes/42/79242/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: msg = 'Context must be a dictionary or json compatible string:' if isinstance(context, dict): context = json.dumps(context) else: json.loads(context) except Exception as e: raise ex.IllegalArgumentException(' '.join((msg, str(e)))) return context if context:
deleted_lines: msg = 'Context must be a dictionary or json compatible string.' context_as_str = str(context) json.loads(context_as_str) except Exception as e: raise ex.IllegalArgumentException(msg + e) return context_as_str if context is not None:

The backup unittests were using the actual cmd from the backup
implementation (eg. innobackupex) instead of the faked unit test
cmd. Fixed this so that calls to innobackupex are no longer being

Closes-bug: 1290290
Change-Id: I26b77efbf95feb5a32777197c7cba08f7b757c38

commit_message:
Fixed backup unittests to use mocked cmd

The backup unittests were using the actual cmd from the backup
implementation (eg. innobackupex) instead of the faked unit test
cmd. Fixed this so that calls to innobackupex are no longer being
made when running the unit tests.

Closes-bug: 1290290
Change-Id: I26b77efbf95feb5a32777197c7cba08f7b757c38
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/trove refs/changes/97/79497/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def cmd(self): return self.cmd

commit_message:
Make functions in manila uniquenamed

Manila's devstack plugin has samenamed functions as in
cinder. It makes problems using cinder with manila's installation.
All function names should be unique.

Change-Id: I32fa7aecc7b74692b60c040cabd371f1499c21e6
Closes-Bug: #1290552

commit_message:
Modify API tests to check the calls

Since often mocked response is returned untouched by the tested
function, we need to check not only that it returns the proper
response, but also that it makes a right request too.

Change-Id: I87bf79d9c8648f8377c0c27b1cd4992a6e5af598
Closes-Bug: #1288169

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-22 03:56:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/1d2f32d196ed025e7df12378a88511206290abb9', 'message': 'Use oslo.messaging for AMQP communications

Implements scaffolding for task executor in preparation for port to
oslo.messaging. Separated the new engine implementation under new v1
subdirectory. The engine by default should be scalable and the new
subdirectory structure do not need an explicit scalable module. New
RPC service and client are implemented for the task executor.

Change-Id: Ibce01813e51c2220c45e05bb820b4729027446a3
Implements: blueprint mistral-oslo-messaging
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-27 22:19:28.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/mistral/commit/1f9ec2216d4d43bc4979d7b78dd63cc54e016311', 'message': 'Use oslo.messaging for AMQP communications

Ported task executor to oslo.messaging. The executor module is
replaced with RPC server/client named Executor and ExecutorClient
respectively to handle task execution. The engine is modified to
use the ExecutorClient to send task requests over the transport to
the Executor. The launcher is modified to start the new Executor.

commit_message:
Use oslo.messaging for AMQP communications

Ported task executor to oslo.messaging. The executor module is
replaced with RPC server/client named Executor and ExecutorClient
respectively to handle task execution. The old executor module is
deleted.  The engine is modified to use the ExecutorClient to send
task requests over the transport to the Executor. The launcher is
modified to start the new Executor.

Change-Id: Ibce01813e51c2220c45e05bb820b4729027446a3
Implements: blueprint mistral-oslo-messaging

commit_message:
Fixed creation of cinder's volumes

Manila's function "_configure_tgt_for_config_d"
was imported second and was redefining cinder's
with same name. It caused absense of cinder.conf for
tgt.

Change-Id: I259994b337f857a3f71a37f91e71bbe2543d0815
Closes-Bug: #1290516

commit_message:
Instances are not stuck in BACKUP

Fixed the backup running states, so that a NEW state is no longer
considered running. This means that Instances are not stuck in
BACKUP unless they are actively performing a backup.

Closes-bug: 1252897
Change-Id: Ia9be9f19d695a66bcc2a9b952584139652d97773

commit_message:
Hard disable config drive to test file injection

DO NOT MERGE. This is a test of the test system :). This commit hard
disables config drive forcing file injection to be used instead to see
if file injection is broken everywhere.

Test if libguestfs documentation indicates the proper way to fix
libguestfs on precise.

Change-Id: Iab4d59df24770b402f74ab8591a7ff5ea1a3b3bc

commit_message:
Implement pluggability for tempest (clients)

Third patch of three patches:
  1. exceptions
  2. config (+ module_utils.py)
->3. clients

It is very useful for new projects, who can just place
needed files into appropriate dirs without changing
tempest core files.
Much less merge conflicts and separation of base classes and
child classes.

Partially-implements: bp make-tempest-pluggable

Change-Id: Ib4f5b7004d86a4a194a7bd93905d6b7b12e07801

added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2014 Rackspace # All Rights Reserved. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from sqlalchemy import Column from sqlalchemy import DateTime from sqlalchemy import Index from sqlalchemy import Integer from sqlalchemy import MetaData from sqlalchemy import String from sqlalchemy import Table from nova.openstack.common.gettextutils import _ from nova.openstack.common import log as logging LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) def upgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData(bind=migrate_engine) instance_tasks = Table('instance_tasks', meta, Column('created_at', DateTime(timezone=False)), Column('updated_at', DateTime(timezone=False)), Column('deleted_at', DateTime(timezone=False)), Column('id', Integer, primary_key=True), Column('name', String(255), nullable=False), Column('status', String(255), nullable=False), Column('uuid', String(36), nullable=False), Column('instance_uuid', String(36), nullable=False), Column('tag', String(255)), Column('user_id', String(length=255)), Column('project_id', String(length=255)), Column('start_time', DateTime(timezone=False)), Column('finish_time', DateTime(timezone=False)), Column('deleted', Integer, default=0,), Index('uuid_idx', 'uuid'), Index('instance_uuid_idx', 'instance_uuid'), mysql_engine='InnoDB', mysql_charset='utf8') try: instance_tasks.create() except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Exception while creating table 'instance_tasks'.")) raise def downgrade(migrate_engine): meta = MetaData(bind=migrate_engine) try: instance_tasks = Table('instance_tasks', meta, autoload=True) instance_tasks.drop() except Exception: LOG.exception(_("Exception while dropping 'instance_tasks' table.")) raise

commit_message:
Add "list fping servers" tests for Nova V2 api

This commit adds tests for Nova V2 API:
    'GET os-fping'
NOTE: This API is only in Nova V2. So we don't need this for Nova V3.

Change-Id: Ie3c9279132900db28dc0362c01955097e01147b7
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/44/77544/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def get_fping_list(self): url = "os-fping" resp, body = self.get(url) body = json.loads(body) return resp, body

commit_message:
Add -N option to force using the local environment

Add the -N option to force using the local environement and not creating
a new virtualenv. Unlike other OpenStack project this option is default
in heat, we add it to match what other projects are doing and make it
easier to maintain integration scripts for packagers.

Partial-Bug: #1273598
Change-Id: I3b84613ef30926a1dd5e979278a615c0f11c0cde
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/03/69703/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: echo " -V, --virtual-env Always Use virtualenv. Install automatically if not present." echo " -N, --no-virtual-env Don't use virtualenv. Run tests in local environment. (Default)" -N|--no-virtual-env) no_venv=1;;
deleted_lines: echo " -V, --virtual-env Use virtualenv. Install automatically if not present." echo " (Default is to run tests in local environment)"

commit_message:
VPNaaS integration with service type framework

* adds new attribute 'provider' for vpnservice
* adds support for multiple drivers for vpn

Implements blueprint vpn-service-types-integration
DocImpact

Change-Id: I9e195dfaee21b1cf204cb9b9fc773bc9e5af5936

'service_drivers.GenericVPNRpcDriver:default') cfg.CONF.set_override('service_provider', [vpnaas_provider], 'service_providers') #force service type manager to reload configuration: sdb.ServiceTypeManager._instance = None self.addCleanup(cfg.CONF.reset) provider='vpnaas', 'provider': provider, provider='vpnaas', provider=provider, def test_create_vpnservice_with_invalid_provider(self): """Test case to create a vpnservice.""" with self.subnet(cidr='10.2.0.0/24') as subnet: with self.router() as router: self._create_vpnservice( self.fmt, 'fake_vpnservice', True, subnet['subnet']['id'], router['router']['id'], provider='fake', expected_res_status=400)

commit_message:
resource-list fails on a stack with ResourceGroup

The ResourceGroup does not have nested resources. This causes a
an AttributeError when doing a resource-list.

Co-Authored-By: Keith Bray <keith.bray@rackspace.com>
Change-Id: I5428f4ea9e935b29a81f9a9cd8e7536d427f4cce
Closes-Bug: #1280391

commit_message:
Add APIv3 support to make host optional on evacuate.

In the event of an unrecoverable hardware failure, support needs to
relocate an instance to another compute so it can be rebuilt.
  [*] Bump v3 version of evacuate to set host argument optional.

DocImpact: The evacuate target host is now optional. If
'host' field is not sent in the request, the scheduler
will determine the target host. This will include
nova client changes ( on the proper commit ) to support
this new optional parameter.

Implements: blueprint find-host-and-evacuate-instance

Change-Id: I787853dcb6ba4e57a5726752a66487ef4472b01f
Co-Authored-By: Juan M. Olle <juan.m.olle@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Andres Buraschi <andres.buraschi@intel.com>
Co-Authored-By: Anuj Mathur <anujm@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Navneet Kumar <navneetk@thoughtworks.com>
Co-Authored-By: Claxton Correya <claxton@gmail.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/53/76853/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: host = evacuate_body.get("host") if host: try: self.host_api.service_get_by_compute_host(context, host) except exception.NotFound: msg = _("Compute host %s not found.") % host raise exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg) version = 2
deleted_lines: host = evacuate_body["host"] try: self.host_api.service_get_by_compute_host(context, host) except exception.NotFound: msg = _("Compute host %s not found.") % host raise exc.HTTPNotFound(explanation=msg) version = 1

commit_message:
Add flake8 to run_tests.sh

Devstack has not only shell scripts but also some python tools in the
tools directory. So we should check whether the code keeps the pep8
rules automatically.

Change-Id: I2d27eda0dd8551289dc4ad7c7652101ba235b987
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/69/77769/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: retval_bash8=$? echo echo "Running flake8..." flake8 -v --statistics --exclude=files,.git ./tools retval_flak8=$? exit $((retval_bash8 != 0 || retval_flak8 != 0))

commit_message:
Add rabbit.cookie attribute

All nodes in rabbitmq cluster should have same cookie. This patch adds
default random cookie to existing templates.

commit_message:
Handle options not registered on module import

Try to discover and include options that are not registered on module import but
when actually executing the code.

We find calls to register_opts() that cannot be handled on import, extract the
arguments and explicitly call register_opt() to make oslo.config aware of them.

Change-Id: I4566b68b59d5a7a1e15cbd3fb9fcec1a51f9abac
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/38/78138/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # List of modules that cause problems and cannot be handled for now _MODULES_EXCEPTIONS = [ # redefines 'periodic_interval' 'neutron.services.loadbalancer.agent.agent', ] # List of module functions that need to be called to register some options _FUNCTIONS_TO_CALL = { 'neutron.plugins.nicira.dhcp_meta.lsnmanager': {'register_lsn_opts': [cfg]}, 'neutron.plugins.nicira.dhcp_meta.nsx': {'register_dhcp_opts': [cfg], 'register_metadata_opts': [cfg]}, 'neutron.plugins.bigswitch.config': {'register_config': []}, 'neutron.plugins.nuage.common.config': {'nuage_register_cfg_opts': []} } # We only deal with code containing registered config options with open(os.path.join(root, pyfile)) as fd: file_content = fd.read() if ('Opt(' not in file_content or 'CONF.register_opt' not in file_content): continue if modname in _MODULES_EXCEPTIONS: continue # Some options are registered by calling a function, not on # import. We call these functions explicitely. if modname in _FUNCTIONS_TO_CALL.keys(): for func, args in _FUNCTIONS_TO_CALL[modname].items(): if verbose >= 2: print("Calling %(mod)s.%(func)s" % {'mod': modname, 'func': func}) getattr(module, func)(*args)

revisions:

We don't use the information about defining module anywhere. Using

Change-Id: I946c740cd0ce6fa5d969964d79a75a406e8453ab
"}]
commit_message:
Stop using generator._list_opts; use cfg.CONF instead

We don't use the information about defining module anywhere. Using
that routine just makes the code slower and causes crashes in Neutron
and possibly elsewhere whenever an option is defined in the top level
but not registered.

Change-Id: I946c740cd0ce6fa5d969964d79a75a406e8453ab
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-doc-tools refs/changes/76/79076/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import stevedore self._verbose = verbose for optname in cfg.CONF._opts: self._add_opt(optname, 'DEFAULT', cfg.CONF._opts[optname]['opt']) for group in cfg.CONF._groups: for optname in cfg.CONF._groups[group]._opts: self._add_opt(group + '/' + optname, group, cfg.CONF._groups[group]._opts[optname]['opt']) def _add_opt(self, optname, group, opt): if optname in self._opts_by_name: if self._verbose >= 2: print ("Duplicate option name %s" % optname) else: self._opts_by_name[optname] = (group, opt) self._opt_names.append(optname) def load_extension_options(self, module): # Note that options loaded this way aren't added to _opts_by_module loader = stevedore.named.NamedExtensionManager( 'oslo.config.opts', names=(module,), invoke_on_load=False ) for ext in loader: for group, opts in ext.plugin(): for opt in opts: if group is None: self._add_opt(opt.name, 'DEFAULT', opt) else: self._add_opt(group + '/' + opt.name, group, opt) group, option = options.get_option(optname)
deleted_lines: self._opts_by_module = {} for modname in modules.keys(): modopts = generator._list_opts(modules[modname]) if len(modopts) == 0: continue self._opts_by_module[modname] = [] for group, opts in modopts: for opt in opts: self._opts_by_module[modname].append((group, opt)) if group == 'DEFAULT': optname = opt.name else: optname = group + '/' + opt.name if optname in self._opts_by_name: oldmod = self._opts_by_name[optname][0] if oldmod.startswith(modname + '.'): if verbose >= 2: print(("Duplicate option name %s" + " from %s and %s. Using %s.") % (optname, modname, oldmod, oldmod)) elif modname.startswith(oldmod + '.'): self._opts_by_name[optname] = (modname, group, opt) if verbose >= 2: print (("Duplicate option name %s" " from %s and %s. Using %s.") % (optname, modname, oldmod, modname)) elif verbose >= 2: print (("Duplicate option name %s" " from %s and %s. Taking one at random.") % (optname, modname, oldmod)) else: self._opts_by_name[optname] = (modname, group, opt) self._opt_names.append(optname) modname, group, option = options.get_option(optname)

commit_message:
Add hacking check for inline comments with spaces

Add a hacking check to ensure inline comments are started with a space,
like '# my comment' instead of '#my comment'.

Change-Id: I06ab02e8a0b5ae9cd30734d2286bd147f7477f3d

put libvirt debug in the right place

libvirt debug setting was happening in a place where we weren't
actually resetting the daemon. Move it to into the hypervisor
plugin where we do.

commit_message:
Prepare for enabling H302 rule (api/compute/admin)

We can use H302 rule but ignore it now. This commit prepares for
enabling H302 rule. But this commit modifies a part of Tempest only
because if we fix all of them at one time, it's hard to merge this
commit.

    ---------------
    tempest/api/compute/admin     <- This patch
    tempest/api/compute/{c*,f*,i*,s*,t*}
    tempest/api/compute/{v3,volumes},data_processing
    tempest/api/identity/admin
    tempest/api/image
    tempest/api/{n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/api/volume,tempest/*
    tempest/services/compute/json
    tempest/services/compute/v3/json
    tempest/services/compute/xml
    tempest/services/identity
    tempest/services/{im*,n*,o*,t*}
    tempest/services/volume
    tempest/clients.py: TBD
    ---------------

Change-Id: Id993c8b157c0b1256aa17c2b8e8f8da46111c521

commit_message:
xenapi: fix spawn servers with ephemeral disks

The new resize ephemeral disk code uses vdis["ephemerals"] to pass the
list of ephemeral vdis to the resize disk code. This is shared between
spawn and resize. As spawn wants to resize the root disk, resize=True
during the spawn operation.

The code in _attach_disks correctly deals with empty ephemeral disks,
but the code in _resize_up_vdis did not, and failed due to
ephemeral_vdis being None.

This is a quick fix for the issue. We need some refactoring in this area
so there is, ideally, only one place that generates ephemeral disks.

Change-Id: If058c5c17c2ed76569fd98d4a3d8e5274721fbd0
Closes-Bug: #1289361

subject: Fix lack of extended port's attributes in Metaplugin
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 04:19:46.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/9dfda9bff55a5c85950441a93307d4feed41b2b0', 'message': "Fix lack of extended port's attributes in Metaplugin

Now, get_port/get_ports of target plugins are called so that
extended port's attributes are handled properly.

Change-Id: Ifed2505a97ceca56c4cedd22efa49adcdf3317b8
Closes-Bug: #1136252
"}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-03-10 01:18:29.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/metaplugin/test_metaplugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/metaplugin/meta_neutron_plugin.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/neutron/commit/7a67a5676fb82ddb717e6b606cc702c31523b9fa', 'message': "Fix lack of extended port's attributes in Metaplugin

Previously, there are some extended port's attributes did not
appear in the result of GET port API when using Metaplugin.
This become a critial issue currently since lack of port binding
information disturbs normal port binding operation in a compute
node, for example.

Metaplugin did not delegate get_port/get_ports to target plugins.
This is cause of the problem because right plugin instance is not
passed to a hook which handles extended attributes.
Now, get_port/get_ports of target plugins are called so that

commit_message:
Fix lack of extended port's attributes in Metaplugin

Previously, there are some extended port's attributes did not
appear in the result of GET port API when using Metaplugin.
This become a critial issue currently since lack of port binding
information disturbs normal port binding operation in a compute
node, for example.

Metaplugin did not delegate get_port/get_ports to target plugins.
This is cause of the problem because right plugin instance is not
passed to a hook which handles extended attributes.
Now, get_port/get_ports of target plugins are called so that
extended port's attributes are handled properly.

Change-Id: Ifed2505a97ceca56c4cedd22efa49adcdf3317b8
Closes-Bug: #1136252
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/08/70908/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from neutron import context as neutron_contextdef _meta_port_model_hook(context, original_model, query): return query.join(NetworkFlavor, NetworkFlavor.network_id == models_v2.Port.network_id) db_base_plugin_v2.NeutronDbPluginV2.register_model_query_hook( models_v2.Port, 'metaplugin_port', _meta_port_model_hook, None, _meta_flavor_filter_hook) port_in_db = self._get_port(context, id) port_in_db = self._get_port(context, id) # This is necessary since there is a case that # NeutronManager.get_plugin()._make_port_dict is called. def _make_port_dict(self, port): context = neutron_context.get_admin_context() plugin = self._get_plugin_by_network_id(context, port['network_id']) return plugin._make_port_dict(port) def get_port(self, context, id, fields=None): port_in_db = self._get_port(context, id) plugin = self._get_plugin_by_network_id(context, port_in_db['network_id']) return plugin.get_port(context, id, fields) def get_ports(self, context, filters=None, fields=None): all_ports = [] for flavor, plugin in self.plugins.items(): if filters: #NOTE: copy each time since a target plugin may modify # plugin_filters. plugin_filters = filters.copy() else: plugin_filters = {} plugin_filters[FLAVOR_NETWORK] = [flavor] ports = plugin.get_ports(context, plugin_filters, fields) all_ports += ports return all_ports
deleted_lines: port_in_db = self.get_port(context, id) port_in_db = self.get_port(context, id)

commit_message:
Add App Detail page

This patch added a new App Details page to App Catalog.
Right now it uses fake model application but
UI render part is complete.
There is no error handling here yet, it should be
added later.
The main purpose of this prototype is to define
an API methods we will need to render UI.
This stuff do not cover Icons yet.

Change-Id: I6ae9f76ac9db88e7918a1fa5add5632b0865985f

commit_message:
Add tiles view for App Catalog

This patch adds a main view for App Catalog.
This is a first draft of App Catalog page based
on tiles approach. App Catalog page has two
sections:
Latest Apps - the newest? or probably last used by his user
App List a list of apps with pagination and category filter.

Change-Id: I70d2ab25bfc13a0aa410f808aaac11050db38242

commit_message:
Stress runner friendly logging.conf.sample

tempest.common.log.TestsFormatter formatter was removed from the tempest
repository. It makes the current sample config file useless.
We will use the same ContextFormatter in the sample config as we use in the
normal runs.

The tempest.log file will be appended, instead of replacing.
The summary of the stress runs will be printed to the stdout.

The syslog handler preserved in the sample config, but it is not in use
anymore. If someone want to use, he can enable it by little change.

NOTE:
You need change tempest.conf [DEFAULT]/log_config_append to point a valid
logging config, if you would like to use special log related
configuration.

Change-Id: Ic6ede3943e309a102d4af6dec505f0d4cbd3bc2b

commit_message:
Provide attribute schema for waitcondition resource

Provide the waitcondition resource with an attribute schema defining
the Data attribute, so it will show up in the template guide docs.

Closes-Bug: #1280268

Change-Id: I8bcbd4b6795d4ca682ed933de437164675f66dc7

commit_message:
Add Images for App Catalog

This patch adds some logic around image handling.
Added images for app entries and details page.
Added image caching logic to store images on local disk.
Added Content-Cache header to cache images on client side too.

git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/murano-dashboard refs/changes/26/79126/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (c) 2013 Mirantis, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. import logging import os import time from muranodashboard.environments.consts import IMAGE_CACHE_DIR LOG = logging.getLogger(__name__) CHUNK_SIZE = 2048 if not os.path.exists(IMAGE_CACHE_DIR): os.mkdir(IMAGE_CACHE_DIR) LOG.info('Creating image cache directory located at {dir}'. format(dir=IMAGE_CACHE_DIR)) LOG.info('Using image cache directory located at {dir}'. format(dir=IMAGE_CACHE_DIR)) class ImageCache(object): """ Cache is a map which keeps the filenames for images """ cache = {} last_clean = time.time() #TODO (gokrokve) define this as a config parameter max_cached_count = 120 #TODO (gokrokve) define this as a config parameter cache_age = 120 def __init__(self, **kwargs): pass def get_entry(self, name): entry = self.cache.get(name, None) if entry is None: return else: LOG.debug("Cached entry: %s" % name) data = load_from_file(entry['file_name']) entry['last_updated'] = time.time() return data def put_cache(self, name, file_name): self.cache[name] = { 'file_name': file_name, 'last_updated': time.time() } def clean(self): LOG.debug("Clean cache entries.") current_time = time.time() for k, v in self.cache.items(): if current_time - v['last_updated'] > self.cache_age: LOG.debug("Remove old entry %s" % k) self.cache.pop(k) def load_from_file(file_name): if os.path.exists(file_name): data = [] with open(file_name, 'rb') as f: buf = f.read(CHUNK_SIZE) while buf: data.append(buf) buf = f.read(CHUNK_SIZE) return data else: return None

commit_message:
Use debug level logging during unit tests

When unit tests fail we need to debug, so we should have debug level logging on.
We use fixtures FakeLogger during testing, to  enable debug logging pass
in log level as a parameter.
http://bazaar.launchpad.net/~python-fixtures/python-fixtures/trunk/view/head:/lib/fixtures/_fixtures/logger.py#L68

Change-Id: I70790aa39c0774726de71e5fa5751c45e7e34ffd

commit_message:
Fix debug message formatting in server_external_events

Hopefully this will be the last case of invalid debug log messages to
fix before turning on debug level log messages on during unit tests, so
we can gate on issues like this.

Change-Id: I8a2b64222deaf5320bcc2e5215b6bd46565a505f

commit_message:
Add host_routes property to Neutron subnet resource

Template snippet that was functionally tested:

subnet:
  Type: OS::Neutron::Subnet
  Properties:
    host_routes:
    - {destination: 192.168.1.0/24, nexthop: 192.168.1.2}
    network_id: {Ref: network}
    ip_version: 4
    cidr: 10.0.3.0/24
    allocation_pools:
    - {end: 10.0.3.150, start: 10.0.3.20}

(Next hop probably would make more sense to be in the CIDR)

Change-Id: I36f72f006a1ba48a6ed55a1c361b3df8d1359caa
Closes-Bug: #1250710

commit_message:
Use instance object instead of _instance_update()

Currently, if a user takes a snapshot of a VM, stops nova-cpu
before the snapshot operation is finished, and restart nova-cpu:
nova-cpu will crash with the error:
AttributeError: 'dict' object has no attribute 'task_state'
This happens because the _instance_update() method returns a dict
and not an Instance object.

This patch fixes the issue by not using _instance_update()
in the compute manager which is returning a dict and using
the instance object instead.

Change-Id: I3af0b09aeff7790b147a684f7c90af17d8ee7ae2
Closes-Bug: #1287945

'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-02-18 00:24:58.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/heat/commit/7ac05abc3952b1d381f3e60ea795039e8b06ae60', 'message': 'Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I97df5651dc6f27ed4ddc7355c21ab61270b15b68

commit_message:
Resource type implementation for software deployment

Some notes on the implementation:
  * Whenever a config should be deployed, this resource loads the config
    and creates an ephemeral derived config which has the following inputs
    added to it:
    * deploy_server_id
    * deploy_action
    * deploy_stack_id
    * deploy_resource_name
  * When signal_transport=CFN_SIGNAL, the folling input is added:
    * deploy_signal_id
  * When signal_transport=HEAT_SIGNAL, the folling inputs are added:
    * deploy_auth_url
    * deploy_username
    * deploy_password
    * deploy_project_id
    These inputs can be used by the hook *or* by the configuration script
    itself.
  * The ephemeral config also has the current input values inserted into
    the 'value' field of the config inputs. This allows the deployment
    metadata to be a simple list of configs.
  * Subclasses of SoftwareDeployment can make further transformations to
    the ephemeral config, such as transforming the config script to contain
    input values.
  * SoftwareDeployment is a SignalResponder so that it can receive
    output value updates from the server via curl or cfn-signal
  * By default, SoftwareDeployment remains in an IN_PROGRESS state
    until a signal is received
  * If wait_for_signal=False the resource will go immediately to COMPLETE
  * A deployment resource can be configured to deploy on any action.
    By default it deploys on CREATE and UPDATE
  * The outputs deploy_stderr, deploy_stdout and deploy_status_code
    are defined in the attributes schema, but other attributes map to
    whatever outputs are defined for the corresponding config resource
  * The resource will go into a FAILED state if an error_output output
    has a value, or if deploy_status_code is non-zero
  * If the 'name' property is set, this will set the 'name' property
    of the derived config, which will determine the sort order of configs
    returned when fetching a list of config metadata for a given server.
  * When an input_value is set where there is no corresponding config
    inputs schema entry, the derived config will add those input schemas
    to the derived input. This allows some templates to be more DRY.

Implements: blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I97df5651dc6f27ed4ddc7355c21ab61270b15b68
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat refs/changes/24/67624/15 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # vim: tabstop=4 shiftwidth=4 softtabstop=4 # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. from heat.engine import properties from heat.engine import signal_responder from heat.openstack.common import log as logging from heat.common import exception import heatclient.exc as heat_exp logger = logging.getLogger(__name__) class SoftwareDeployment(signal_responder.SignalResponder): PROPERTIES = ( CONFIG_ID, SERVER_ID, INPUT_VALUES ) = ( 'config_id', 'server_id', 'input_values' ) DEPLOY_ACTIONS = ( DEPLOY, REDEPLOY, UNDEPLOY ) = ( 'DEPLOY', 'REDEPLOY', 'UNDEPLOY' ) DEPLOY_STATUSES = ( WAITING, RECEIVED, FAILED ) = ( 'WAITING', 'RECEIVED', 'FAILED' ) properties_schema = { CONFIG_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('ID of software configuration resource to execute when ' 'applying to the server.'), update_allowed=True ), SERVER_ID: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.STRING, _('ID of Nova server to apply configuration to.'), ), INPUT_VALUES: properties.Schema( properties.Schema.MAP, _('Input values to apply to the software configuration on this ' 'server'), update_allowed=True ) } update_allowed_keys = ('Properties',) def handle_create(self): super(SoftwareDeployment, self).handle_create() props = dict(self.properties) props['status'] = self.WAITING props['status_reason'] = _('Deploy data available') props['action'] = self.DEPLOY props['signal_id'] = self._get_signed_url() sd = self.heat().software_deployments.create(**props) self.resource_id_set(sd.id) return sd def check_create_complete(self, sd): sd.get() if sd.status == self.RECEIVED: return True elif sd.status == self.FAILED: exc = exception.Error(_("Deployment to server " "failed: %s") % sd.status_reason) raise exc def handle_signal(self, details): sd = self.heat().software_deployments.get(self.resource_id) if not sd.status == self.WAITING: # output values are only expected when in an WAITING state return details = details or {} ov = sd.output_values or {} status = None status_reasons = {} for output in sd.outputs: out_key = output['name'] if out_key in details: ov[out_key] = details[out_key] if output.get('error_output', False): status = self.FAILED status_reasons[out_key] = details[out_key] if status == self.FAILED: # build a status reason out of all of the values of outputs # flagged as error_output status_reason = ', '.join([' : '.join((k, str(status_reasons[k]))) for k in status_reasons]) else: status = self.RECEIVED status_reason = _('Outputs received') sd.update(output_values=ov, status=status, status_reason=status_reason) def handle_delete(self): super(SoftwareDeployment, self).handle_delete() if self.resource_id is not None: try: self.heat().software_deployments.delete(self.resource_id) except heat_exp.HTTPNotFound: pass def handle_update(self, json_snippet, tmpl_diff, prop_diff): props = dict(self.properties) sc = self.heat().software_deployments.get(self.resource_id) sc.update(**props) def FnGetAtt(self, key): ''' Resource attributes map to deployment outputs values ''' sd = self.heat().software_deployments.get(self.resource_id) for output in sd.outputs: if output['name'] == key: return sd.output_values.get(key) raise exception.InvalidTemplateAttribute(resource=self.name, key=key) def resource_mapping(): return { 'OS::Heat::SoftwareDeployment': SoftwareDeployment, }

commit_message:
Remove signal_id from deployments API and model

The same information is now available from the deployment's
derived config deploy_signal_id input value.

Other deployment signal transports might not have a single ID
to put in this field so it is better at this stage to remove
it from the deployments model and do anything that is required
using derived config inputs.

partial blueprint hot-software-config

Change-Id: I90c85d0ceb9fd67eed640c84348ef4175a6194b6

commit_message:
Adding missing indexes for trove db

Wraped creates in a try/except to avoid problems if idx exists
Updated number-naming for scripts

Change-Id: I81e59f2f54dab73fc794fae0df9e1751e5896530
Closes-Bug: #1214188

commit_message:
Document Assignments feature

The assignments feature allows admins to separate role authorization
and user authentication when the Identity Service is configured to
use an LDAP back end. This patch adds instructions on how to do so.

Change-Id: I46d6b090ae126b880003020dc0eb9112a44dabb0
Closes-Bug: #1290629
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/05/79505/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <?xml version="1.0" encoding="UTF-8"?> <section xmlns="http://docbook.org/ns/docbook" xmlns:xi="http://www.w3.org/2001/XInclude" xmlns:xlink="http://www.w3.org/1999/xlink" version="5.0" xml:id="configuring-keystone-for-ldap-backend-assignments"> <title>Separate role authorization and user authentication</title> <para>When you configure the Identity Service to use an LDAP back end, you can split authentication and authorization using the <emphasis>Assignments</emphasis> feature.</para> <para>The <emphasis>Assignments</emphasis> feature enables administrators to manage project role authorization using the Identity Service's own SQL database, while still providing user authentication through the LDAP directory.</para> <para>To configure this:</para> <procedure> <title>Separating role authorization and user authentication through the Assignment feature</title> <step> <para>Configure the Identity service user authentication to use the LDAP driver. To do so, open the <filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename> configuration file and set the <literal>driver</literal> configuration key in the <literal>[identity]</literal> section to <literal>keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity</literal>: </para> <programlisting>[identity] driver = keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity</programlisting> </step> <step><para>Next, enable the Assignment driver. To do so, open the <filename>/etc/keystone/keystone.conf</filename> configuration file and set the <literal>driver</literal> configuration key in the <literal>[assignment]</literal> section to <literal>keystone.assignment.backends.sql.Assignment</literal>: </para> <programlisting>[assignment] driver = keystone.assignment.backends.sql.Assignment</programlisting> </step> </procedure> <para os="rhel;centos;fedora;opensuse;sles">On distributions that include <application>openstack-config</application>, you can configure both drivers by running the following commands instead: </para> <screen os="rhel;centos;fedora;opensuse;sles"><prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/keystone/keystone.conf \ identity driver keystone.identity.backends.ldap.Identity</userinput> <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/keystone/keystone.conf \ assignment driver keystone.assignment.backends.sql.Assignment</userinput></screen> </section>

subject: Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 06:54:40.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/tests/test_exception.py', 'cinder/exception.py', 'cinder/utils.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/af4231a8eaf86b43b71c551b65acfcfbe938fa49', 'message': 'Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword argument.

Bad example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Oorah

Good example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported
      an error: Oorah

In cinder/utils.py, it is using the invalid keyword arguments as
follows. It is not intended probably.

  raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

It is usually 'reason=msg', but since messages would change, put
only 'msg'.

Change-Id: I563e6d01128a8d37e9d31826bcbec38f2fc7609c
Closes-Bug: #1288066
'}]
commit_message:
Fix bad exception message output by %(message)s

Since 'message' is the same name as the second argument to the
constructor, 'message="Oorah"' is not a keyword argument.

Bad example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Oorah

Good example:
  raise exception.VolumeDriverException(message="Oorah")
  ==> cinder.exception.VolumeDriverException: Volume driver reported
      an error: Oorah

In cinder/utils.py, it is using the invalid keyword arguments as
follows. It is not intended probably.

  raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

It is usually 'reason=msg', but since messages would change, put
only 'msg'.

Change-Id: I563e6d01128a8d37e9d31826bcbec38f2fc7609c
Closes-Bug: #1288066
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/15/78115/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: raise exception.InvalidInput(msg) raise exception.InvalidInput(msg) raise exception.InvalidInput(msg)
deleted_lines: raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg) raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg) raise exception.InvalidInput(message=msg)

commit_message:
Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is
that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.

Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have
exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.

Change-Id: I58a43c77e1adda52f9984203697e0ccf97cda235
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/84/79484/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Adds nfs-server element

This patch adds an element that installs and configures nfs
services for testing the cinder nfs backend in an environment
where no nfs services are present (e.g. CI)

When added to an image, this element creates a directory at
/mnt/state/var/lib/nfs and shares it to each node of the
overcloud.

This patch that handles the package mapping in diskimage-builder
needs to be applied first: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/76398/.

Change-Id: I4c425af64b866caa80b32b808e8a3b97d71ca81d

commit_message:
Fix retry logic

When passing retry=True to verify_uuid_token this later should
re-call it self when the method fail and this time with retry=False.

Change-Id: I7e8f478e5116ac4119df134587f29f3f25ae8a42
Closes-Bug: #1285847

environment

commit_message:
Increase testing of network connectivity

Adds ping against VM's internal network elements:
need all of them because agents might be located on different hosts
    1. Router port
    2. DHCP port

Adds ping against public network default gateway implying external
connectivity. Any further network tests are outside the Openstack cloud and the
testing environment

Partially Implements: blueprint neutron-advanced-scenarios

Change-Id: I9aaba5496581c9e3472d7a3846b1a0464f6334e6

commit_message:
Give the seed and undercloud more IPs to work with

We have a /24 range to work with, and would like to support seed
->overcloud for test performance. This requires enough IPs to
deploy the overcloud to be available on the seed.

Change-Id: I05a9d2fc70e10870b777590ea4841cc44c33f974

commit_message:
Add options to use remove_unused_* parameters

Being able to modify the parameters "remove_unused_base_images",
"remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds",
"remove_unused_kernels", "remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds"
if desired.

Change-Id: Ia24594ccc4b999674456e59a279e2d5916cd5d7a
Implements: blueprint add-remove-unused-parameters
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-nova refs/changes/81/77881/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # [*remove_unused_base_images*] # (optional) Should unused base images be removed? # Defaults to undef # # [*remove_unused_kernels*] # (optional) Should unused kernel images be removed? # This is only safe to enable if all compute nodes # have been updated to support this option. # Defaults to undef # # [*remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds*] # (optional) Unused resized base images younger # than this will not be removed # Defaults to undef # # [*remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds*] # (optional) Unused unresized base images younger # than this will not be removed # Defaults to undef # $libvirt_virt_type = 'kvm', $vncserver_listen = '127.0.0.1', $migration_support = false, $libvirt_cpu_mode = false, $libvirt_disk_cachemodes = [], $remove_unused_base_images = undef, $remove_unused_kernels = undef, $remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds = undef, $remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds = undef, $libvirt_type = false if $remove_unused_kernels != undef { nova_config { 'libvirt/remove_unused_kernels': value => $remove_unused_kernels; } } else { nova_config { 'libvirt/remove_unused_kernels': ensure => absent; } } if $remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds != undef { nova_config { 'libvirt/remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds': value => $remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds; } } else { nova_config { 'libvirt/remove_unused_resized_minimum_age_seconds': ensure => absent; } } if $remove_unused_base_images != undef { nova_config { 'DEFAULT/remove_unused_base_images': value => $remove_unused_base_images; } } else { nova_config { 'DEFAULT/remove_unused_base_images': ensure => absent; } } if $remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds != undef { nova_config { 'DEFAULT/remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds': value => $remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds; } } else { nova_config { 'DEFAULT/remove_unused_original_minimum_age_seconds': ensure => absent; } }

commit_message:
Log 'image_id' with all BadStoreURI error messages

- handle all BadStoreUri exceptions raised by 'legacy_parse_uri'
  function in
one location so that it becomes easier to log the error message with
'image_id'
- add tests for 'legacy_parse_uri'

Closes-Bug: #1243704

Change-Id: Ifc5de11832860ed51c1eb359d6f5cf78de8c0ba4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/glance refs/changes/53/53353/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from glance.common import utils try: fixed_uri = utils.legacy_parse_swift_uri(image['location'], to_quoted) images_table.update()\ .where(images_table.c.id == image['id'])\ .values(location=fixed_uri).execute() except exception.BadStoreUri as e: err_msg = _("Invalid store uri for image %s: %s") % (image.id, unicode(e)) LOG.error(err_msg) raise exception.BadStoreUri(message=err_msg)
deleted_lines: import urllib import urlparse fixed_uri = legacy_parse_uri(image['location'], to_quoted, image['id']) images_table.update()\ .where(images_table.c.id == image['id'])\ .values(location=fixed_uri).execute() def legacy_parse_uri(uri, to_quote, image_id): """ Parse URLs. This method fixes an issue where credentials specified in the URL are interpreted differently in Python 2.6.1+ than prior versions of Python. It also deals with the peculiarity that new-style Swift URIs have where a username can contain a ':', like so: swift://account:user:pass@authurl.com/container/obj If to_quoted is True, the uri is assumed to have credentials that have not been quoted, and the resulting uri will contain quoted credentials. If to_quoted is False, the uri is assumed to have credentials that have been quoted, and the resulting uri will contain credentials that have not been quoted. """ # Make sure that URIs that contain multiple schemes, such as: # swift://user:pass@http://authurl.com/v1/container/obj # are immediately rejected. if uri.count('://') != 1: reason = _("URI cannot contain more than one occurrence of a scheme." "If you have specified a URI like " "swift://user:pass@http://authurl.com/v1/container/obj" ", you need to change it to use the swift+http:// scheme, " "like so: " "swift+http://user:pass@authurl.com/v1/container/obj") LOG.error(_("Invalid store uri for image %s: %s") % (image_id, reason)) raise exception.BadStoreUri(message=reason) pieces = urlparse.urlparse(uri) assert pieces.scheme in ('swift', 'swift+http', 'swift+https') scheme = pieces.scheme netloc = pieces.netloc path = pieces.path.lstrip('/') if netloc != '': # > Python 2.6.1 if '@' in netloc: creds, netloc = netloc.split('@') else: creds = None else: # Python 2.6.1 compat # see lp659445 and Python issue7904 if '@' in path: creds, path = path.split('@') else: creds = None netloc = path[0:path.find('/')].strip('/') path = path[path.find('/'):].strip('/') if creds: cred_parts = creds.split(':') # User can be account:user, in which case cred_parts[0:2] will be # the account and user. Combine them into a single username of # account:user if to_quote: if len(cred_parts) == 1: reason = (_("Badly formed credentials '%(creds)s' in Swift " "URI") % locals()) LOG.error(reason) raise exception.BadStoreUri() elif len(cred_parts) == 3: user = ':'.join(cred_parts[0:2]) else: user = cred_parts[0] key = cred_parts[-1] user = user key = key else: if len(cred_parts) != 2: reason = (_("Badly formed credentials in Swift URI.")) LOG.debug(reason) raise exception.BadStoreUri() user, key = cred_parts user = urllib.unquote(user) key = urllib.unquote(key) else: user = None key = None path_parts = path.split('/') try: obj = path_parts.pop() container = path_parts.pop() if not netloc.startswith('http'): # push hostname back into the remaining to build full authurl path_parts.insert(0, netloc) auth_or_store_url = '/'.join(path_parts) except IndexError: reason = _("Badly formed S3 URI: %s") % uri LOG.error(message=reason) raise exception.BadStoreUri() if auth_or_store_url.startswith('http://'): auth_or_store_url = auth_or_store_url[len('http://'):] elif auth_or_store_url.startswith('https://'): auth_or_store_url = auth_or_store_url[len('https://'):] credstring = '' if user and key: if to_quote: quote_user = urllib.quote(user) quote_key = urllib.quote(key) else: quote_user = user quote_key = key credstring = '%s:%s@' % (quote_user, quote_key) auth_or_store_url = auth_or_store_url.strip('/') container = container.strip('/') obj = obj.strip('/') return '%s://%s%s/%s/%s' % (scheme, credstring, auth_or_store_url, container, obj)

commit_message:
3PAR: Support extend volume based on snapshot

If extend volume fails with an HTTP Forbidden error 150,
convert the volume to a base volume and retry extending.

Change-Id: Id407058e954b2630f4a7f31c6149361301b502f2
Closes-Bug: #1285906
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/66/77966/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2.0.7 - Allow extend volume based on snapshot bug #1285906 VERSION = "2.0.7" LOG.debug(_("Extending Volume %(vol)s from %(old)s to %(new)s, " " by %(diff)s GB.") % {'vol': volume_name, 'old': old_size, 'new': new_size, 'diff': growth_size}) self._extend_volume(volume, volume_name, growth_size_mib) def _extend_volume(self, volume, volume_name, growth_size_mib, _convert_to_base=False): try: if _convert_to_base: LOG.debug(_("Converting to base volume prior to growing.")) self._convert_to_base_volume(volume) except Exception as ex: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception() as ctxt: if (not _convert_to_base and isinstance(ex, hpexceptions.HTTPForbidden) and ex.get_code() == 150): # Error code 150 means 'invalid operation: Cannot grow # this type of volume'. # Suppress raising this exception because we can # resolve it by converting it into a base volume. # Afterwards, extending the volume should succeed, or # fail with a different exception/error code. ctxt.reraise = False self._extend_volume(volume, volume_name, growth_size_mib, _convert_to_base=True) else: LOG.error(_("Error extending volume: %(vol)s. " "Exception: %(ex)s") % {'vol': volume, 'ex': ex})
deleted_lines: VERSION = "2.0.6" LOG.debug("Extending Volume %s from %s to %s, by %s GB." % (volume_name, old_size, new_size, growth_size)) try: except Exception: with excutils.save_and_reraise_exception(): LOG.error(_("Error extending volume %s") % volume)

commit_message:
Add driver certificate test requirement

This provides a new driver requirement in passing certificate tests to
ensure tempest tests pass with actual backends.

Change-Id: I2635c1e313c9d1a737d6d28b62c593c5d27c3d44
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/91/73691/4 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: Passing Certificate Test ------------------------ Every driver that is included with Cinder must successfully run and pass the existing OpenStack Tempest tests. While every commit in OpenStack goes through an automated gate test, we ask that since we won't have your backend device to test against, you run this certificate test yourself: https://github.com/openstack-dev/devstack/tree/master/driver_certs The certificate test is a wrapper around tempest that will run the relevant tests and show whether your driver will work properly. The test should be ran as is. You do not need to make modifications to the test. This is on the honor system and forging the results can have **serious consequences**. Copy the output of the tests to http://paste.openstack.org and include the link in a comment with your review. New drivers that do not include the results will not be merged. There are drivers that have been merged before these cert tests existed. They will be included with the Icehouse release and required to pass these tests by the Juno release, or they will be removed. Driver maintainers that have not provided their results to Cinder core before the Icehouse release cut off will not be a certified driver.

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-10 22:22:53.000000000', 'files': ['cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py', 'etc/cinder/cinder.conf.sample', 'tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh', 'tools/conf/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'tools/config/generate_sample.sh', 'cinder/openstack/common/config/__init__.py', 'tools/config/oslo.config.generator.rc', 'cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py', 'run_tests.sh', 'tools/config/check_uptodate.sh', 'tools/conf/generate_sample.sh', 'tox.ini'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/1f21c8bd95a1efd5f0bd1d2561947295c1a096fa', 'message': 'Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.  Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.'}]
commit_message:
Revert "Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n"

This reverts commit 9550b6b6b486559b7c89b94e7ffb20b794aaa795

Hate to do this but this seems to be the culprit for exposing some issues:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/cinder/+bug/1290503

Good news is it looks like the issue has been identified, the problem is that we can't just fix it in Cinder, it needs fixed in OSLO, then synched again.  Also I'm not comfortable given all the hidden issues that this seems to have exposed adding this in this late in the release cycle.
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/cinder refs/changes/76/79476/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: {toxinidir}/tools/conf/check_uptodate.sh

commit_message:
Create secret - case insensitive Content-Type check

Allows for upper case and mixed case types, subtypes, and parameters
in the Content-Type header field as per RFC 1341. More details can
be found at http://www.w3.org/Protocols/rfc1341/4_Content-Type.html.

Closes-Bug: #1252453
Change-Id: I400a05593e0c622de93a47a0fe0394793eb777f1

This sync pulls the latest Oslo config code over
to Cinder.  This sync is needed to include a fix
to config generator.  Config generator was failing
when lazy message translation was enabled.

The following changes are included with this patch. Each
patch includes the file(s) the patch touches:
-> c178e56 Add basic Python 3 tests
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py

commit_message:
Sync latest Oslo config code for i18n

This sync pulls the latest Oslo config code over
to Cinder.  This sync is needed to include a fix
to config generator which is needed as part of
the work to enabled i18n messages.  Config generator
was failing when lazy message translation was enabled.

The following changes are included with this patch. Each
patch includes the file(s) the patch touches:
-> c178e56 Add basic Python 3 tests
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 12bcdb7 Remove vim header
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 547ab34 Fix Copyright Headers - Rename LLC to Foundation
--> cinder/openstack/common/__init__.py
-> 44b6ea3 Import oslo.config configuration file generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/__init__.py
-> dd9aa2b Remove unused variables
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 5dce17b Use entry points to discover options in libraries
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e8e636c generator: add an EXTRA_LIBRARIES env variable
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e3dddd7 generator: use EXTRA_* env vars in the bash script
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 6da13e8 generator: rename EXTRA_MODULES_FILE to RC_FILE
--> tools/config/generate_sample.sh
-> 763eedf Fix DictOpt support in config sample generator
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> e839886 Config generator fails with lazy messages
--> cinder/openstack/common/config/generator.py
-> 343686b Add check_uptodate to tools/config
--> tools/config/check_uptodate.sh

Oslo version:
-> 0f24d82 Fix migration.db_version when no tables
-> Date: Sat, 22 Feb 2014 00:32:18 +0000

Change-Id: I26a95fe96b08d6340b0fce1b9e2949c8e661a946
Closes-Bug: 1280826
Related-bp: i18n-messages

commit_message:
Fix sqlachemy warning

This fixes the following warning:
SAWarning: Ignoring declarative-like tuple value of attribute timestamp:
possibly a copy-and-paste error with a comma left at the end of the line?

Change-Id: Ibda917862ffcc777d7c7d81f264e24e6511446fd
Fixes-Bug: #1286947
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/52/78852/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: timestamp = sqlalchemy.Column(sqlalchemy.DateTime)

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API

still being imported in the cinder.openstack.common files from Oslo
we still need to set gettexttutils.enable_lazy().  enable_lazy will
be able to be removed once the manual imports of _ have been removed
from Oslo.

"}, {'number': 4, 'created': '2014-02-12 21:56:19.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/cinder/commit/423e8d0fc20be75fa27e96e4428ee9bbfd719a11', 'message': "Re-enable lazy translation

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (I.E. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

Rather than attempt to add 'from cinder.openstack.common.gettextutils import _'
to all of Cinder's files at this point in time, I have instead decided to
cover both possible approaches by setting both 'gettextutils.enable_lazy()'
and 'gettextutils.install('cinder', Lazy=true) .'  This will ensure proper
functionality regardless of the approach taken by the developer.
Moving cinder to manually importing _() can be undertaken via another patch
if deemed appropriate.

Change-Id: I0b5a35a2cc28d97d12ceccccd58565b487fef428
implements-bp: i18n-messages
