commit_message:
Ensure detach before teardown in scenario manager

A number of the scenario tests have issues with teardown
failing to remove volumes.  Most of these cases are delete
failures due to volume status "in-use".

The root cause of most of these seems to be something going
wrong on the compute side when building an instance, attaching or
detaching causing the test to unexpectedly exit.

The problem is that the teardown in scenario manager is a simple
(albeit clever) thing.delete and it doesn't do any status checking
of the things it's trying to delete.

This patch adds a simple check in the thing.delete loop to see if
the cls object is a cinderclient volumes object, if it is it goes
ahead and issues a detach command on the volume just to make certain
that we've cleaned things up properly even if there was a problem
or failure in the test.

Marking this as 'closes' because the symptom being reported in
multiple bugs is the teardown failure of the volume.  This doesn't
solve the root cause, it only addresses the volume teardown issue.

Change-Id: I0b7668fb4a2a673e446a484aa93dd4ab727f78c3
Partial-Bug: #1281351
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/72/74272/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # NOTE(jgriffith): Sometimes the test fails, particularly # on the instance boot, leaving the volume in an in-use # state causing the tearDown to fail on volume.delete # if 'thing' is a volume, let's ensure it's detached if ('cinderclient' and 'volumes') in thing.__module__: thing.detach()

commit_message:
Show error message when image creation fails

This commit will show the exception received from glance when
it fails to create a new image.
It's important to know if the error is due to unavailable space for
instance, so the user can try alternative images.

Change-Id: I6c488dc74d8e4a05f207a653394030071b094f59
Closes-Bug: #1275043

commit_message:
Delete logout reason cookie from login view

Wrap the openstack_auth login view so we can remove the
logout_reason cookie if it exists. This ensures it will be
displayed only the first time the page is displayed.

Change-Id: Ic3ecc3d58db0a22ada71e81f302860e308c5b21c
Closes-Bug: #1231355
Co-Authored-By: Kieran Spear <kispear@gmail.com>

commit_message:
autowsdl-repair utility preprocesses WSDL for SUDS

This is a small utility that preprocesses the old vSphere WSDL
for use with SUDS. It intercepts the SUDS request for a WSDL
and performs cleanup work so that SUDS can properly handle the
vSphere WSDLs even if they are malformed.

DocImpact
Adds optional configuration enable_wsdl_cleaner

Change-Id: I0feb1b6a41ca0823d94f69c1e7ca3d8b32735309
Blueprint: autowsdl-repair
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/oslo.vmware refs/changes/20/77220/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: from oslo.vmware.wsdl import cleaner def __init__(self, protocol='https', host='localhost', wsdl_loc=None, *kwargs): # WSDL cleaner is enabled by default, allow a disable flag here if kwargs.get('enable_wsdl_cleaner', True): wsdl_cleaner = cleaner.WsdlCleaner(wsdl_loc) # NOTE(hartsocks): the WSDL cleaner object only needs # to live long enough to hand its cleaned files over to # SUDS for processing. The tmp directory used by # the cleaner will flush as soon as the object is # garbage collected at the exit of this method. wsdl_loc = wsdl_cleaner.wsdl_url LOG.debug(_("WSDL cleaner temporary location: %s"), wsdl_loc) self.url = Vim.get_soap_url(self._protocol, self._host_name) self.client = suds.client.Client(wsdl_loc, location=soap_url, plugins=[VimMessagePlugin()]) LOG.debug(_("suds.client.Client initialized")) self._service_content = self.retrieve_service_content()
deleted_lines: def __init__(self, protocol='https', host='localhost', wsdl_loc=None): self._client = suds.client.Client(wsdl_loc, location=soap_url, plugins=[VimMessagePlugin()]) self._service_content = self.RetrieveServiceContent('ServiceInstance')

commit_message:
Filter neutron managed quota items from nova api when using neutron

Hide neutron managed quota items(floating_ips, security_groups,
security_group_rules) from nova api to avoid confusion.

Change-Id: I28b6912091f74e4e1954dafb94318e481dbec763
Closes-bug: 1263628

commit_message:
Nova pagination enhancements

Updates the v2 and v3 /servers and /servers/detail APIs to support the
multiple sort keys and sort directions (using the 'sort_key' and
'sort_dir' parameters). These parameters can be specified multiple
times to create a list of sort keys and directions. The 'offset'
parameter is also added. These parameters are passed from the API
layer to the database layer; the datbase layer already supports
them.

A new v3 /servers/count API is added and retrieves the integer
count of servers that match the given sort filters (same filters
as the /servers and /servers/detail APIs). In order to ensure that
the new count function uses the same common code as the existing
APIs, new common functions are added that both paths utilize. New
functions are added to the layers between the API and database to
retrieve the integer count value.

Test cases are added to ensure that the given sort order is honored,
that the offset value is honored, that the next link on the API response
contains the same sorting values and an updated offset (if specified),
and that the count functions return the correct value for various
filters.

Change-Id: I434ff46732f4349717911e32b6f93a08cfd9fca2
Implements: blueprint nova-pagination
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/40/77240/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright 2014 IBM Corp. sort_dir='desc', limit=None, marker=None, offset=None, want_objects=False, expected_attrs=None, sort_keys=None, sort_dirs=None): # Default sort keys and dirs if sort_keys is None: sort_keys = ['created_at'] if sort_key is None else [sort_key] if sort_dirs is None: sort_dirs = ['desc'] if sort_dir is None else [sort_dir] assert(len(sort_dirs) == len(sort_keys)) try: filters = self._process_search_options(context, search_opts=search_opts) except ValueError: # Cannot match the filter, return on empty list return [] inst_models = self._get_instances_by_filters(context, filters, limit=limit, marker=marker, offset=offset, expected_attrs=expected_attrs, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs) if want_objects: return inst_models # Convert the models to dictionaries instances = [] for inst_model in inst_models: instances.append(obj_base.obj_to_primitive(inst_model)) return instances def get_count(self, context, search_opts=None, expected_attrs=None): """Get the number of instances filtered by one of the given parameters. If there is no filter and the context is an admin, it will retrieve all instances in the system. Deleted instances will be returned by default, unless there is a search option that says otherwise. """ try: filters = self._process_search_options(context, search_opts=search_opts) except ValueError: # Cannot match the filter return 0 return self._get_count_by_filters(context, filters, expected_attrs=expected_attrs) def _process_search_options(self, context, search_opts=None): """Common function to process the search options and ensure that the caller has authority. @param context @param search_opts @return filters to use for the instance query @raise ValueError: if the search options does not match a supported filter """ except ValueError: log_msg = _("Search filter '%s' is not supported") LOG.error(log_msg, opt) raise return filters sort_key=None, sort_dir=None, limit=None, marker=None, offset=None, expected_attrs=None, sort_keys=None, sort_dirs=None): """Returns the instances that match the given filters.""" fields = self._process_instance_filters(context, filters, expected_attrs) return instance_obj.InstanceList.get_by_filters( context, filters=filters, sort_key=sort_key, sort_dir=sort_dir, limit=limit, marker=marker, offset=offset, expected_attrs=fields, sort_keys=sort_keys, sort_dirs=sort_dirs) def _get_count_by_filters(self, context, filters, expected_attrs=None): """Returns the number of instances that match the given filters.""" fields = self._process_instance_filters(context, filters, expected_attrs) return instance_obj.InstanceList.get_count_by_filters( context, filters=filters, expected_attrs=fields) def _process_instance_filters(self, context, filters, expected_attrs=None): """Common method to process the instance filters and expected attribute fields before data retrieval. @param context @param filters Specified filters @param expected_attrs @return: Updated list of expected attributes """ return fields
deleted_lines: sort_dir='desc', limit=None, marker=None, want_objects=False, expected_attrs=None): # We already know we can't match the filter, so # return an empty list except ValueError: return [] inst_models = self._get_instances_by_filters(context, filters, sort_key, sort_dir, limit=limit, marker=marker, expected_attrs=expected_attrs) if want_objects: return inst_models # Convert the models to dictionaries instances = [] for inst_model in inst_models: instances.append(obj_base.obj_to_primitive(inst_model)) return instances sort_key, sort_dir, limit=None, marker=None, expected_attrs=None): return instance_obj.InstanceList.get_by_filters( context, filters=filters, sort_key=sort_key, sort_dir=sort_dir, limit=limit, marker=marker, expected_attrs=fields)

commit_message:
VMware: Support hot-adding for VMs with IDE controllers

Volumes cannot be attached to VMs with their primary disk
attached to a ide controller, because hot adding is not
supported for IDE controllers. The patch adds a scsi
controller to VMs that don't support hot adding.

Closes-Bug: 1226543
Change-Id: Ia3ddca6888d9d4ffb1770f45d503400bc7bf29f5

subject: Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-01-21 18:04:35.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/network/test_neutronv2.py', 'nova/network/neutronv2/api.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/22304d600a9b4f4196589234118f024fbd8ce6a1', 'message': 'Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.

This change adds a hack to allow instances to be created with a network
that has no subnets defined as long as the only security group requested is
the "default" one.

The change is admittedly suboptimal as:
 * Pervasiveness of special cases are very undesirable and indicate a
   larger underlying issue.
 * There is no way to tell if the default security group was specified by
   the user or added in the nova API. If throwing the
   SecurityGroupException was appropriate in any case it would apply in
   the latter case.

An alternate approach would be to alter nova to support the notion of a
non-specified security group as valid configuration and allow the system to
treat it with default settings if appropriate. A quick ad-hoc test
indicates that this might be a rather pervasive change.

Fixes bug: 1252410

Change-Id: I6c3a6dd688579bbba7c85097463c3321f9b90350
'}]
commit_message:
Add special case for default secgroup and no subnets.

This change adds a hack to allow instances to be created with a network
that has no subnets defined as long as the only security group requested is
the "default" one.

The change is admittedly suboptimal as:
 * Pervasiveness of special cases are very undesirable and indicate a
   larger underlying issue.
 * There is no way to tell if the default security group was specified by
   the user or added in the nova API. If throwing the
   SecurityGroupException was appropriate in any case it would apply in
   the latter case.

An alternate approach would be to alter nova to support the notion of a
non-specified security group as valid configuration and allow the system to
treat it with default settings if appropriate. A quick ad-hoc test
indicates that this might be a rather pervasive change.

Fixes bug: 1252410

Change-Id: I6c3a6dd688579bbba7c85097463c3321f9b90350
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/91/68191/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # We can currently only apply the no-subnet restriction if # there is a non-default security group specified as there is # no way to specify no-security group through nova. Generally # speaking, the absence of security group information for an # instance is not generally well supported in nova at this # time. We need to allow the special case to allow an instance # to have a network interface when no reasonable subnet can be # defined (e.g. a provider network where the network is managed # outside of OpenStack). if len(security_groups) > 1 or security_groups[0] != 'default': raise exception.SecurityGroupCannotBeApplied()

commit_message:
EMC SMI-S delete snapshot unit test takes too long

EMC SMI-S unit test for deleting snapshot takes too long.
This patch sets Timout to 0 in cinder_emc_config.xml
so that it will return immediately.  Without this fix,
it will wait for 10 seconds by default.

Change-Id: I223f6741a2ce393e555467350201a695ae210152
Closes-Bug: #1289653

commit_message:
Remove unused definition in network base.py

The definition os = clients.Manager(interface=cls._interface) has been
replaced by os = cls.get_client_manager().

Change-Id: Idaa33c8f90de901362d6b5a01719dd0be2e700b4

commit_message:
Add --volume option to image create command

Add ability to create an image from a volume.
* Added --volume command to image create
* Added --force option to image create
* Added block to access volume manager in image create
* Tests added for the volume option

Change-Id: I3910a2b5e04acd0d15dd230747ba6ebca07aa316
Closes-Bug: #1207615

commit_message:
Add support for tenant-provided NSX gateways devices

Add a new API resource specific to the NSX plugin for registering
tenant-owned NSX gateway devices with the NSX controller.
This API also allows tenants for managing gateway devices on the
NSX backend.

The behaviour of the net-gateway extension is mostly unchanged with
the only difference that newly created network gateways can now only
refer exlusively gateway devices registered using the API resource
introduced with this patch.

Implements blueprint nsx-remote-net-gw-integration

Change-Id: Ia2bdd0164498fe46a027b1d8f5a9d9f4e37558a4
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/neutron refs/changes/09/74209/5 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: class GatewayDeviceInUse(exceptions.InUse): message = _("Network Gateway Device '%(device_id)s' is still used by " "one or more network gateways.") class GatewayDeviceNotFound(exceptions.NotFound): message = _("Network Gateway Device %(device_id)s could not be found") class NetworkGatewayDeviceReference(model_base.BASEV2):class NetworkGatewayDevice(model_base.BASEV2, models_v2.HasId, models_v2.HasTenant): nsx_id = sa.Column(sa.String(36), primary_key=True) # Optional name for the gateway device device_name = sa.Column(sa.String(255)) # Transport connector type. Not using enum as range of # connector types might vary with backend version connector_type = sa.Column(sa.String(10)) # Transport connector IP Address connector_ip = sa.Column(sa.String(64)) devices = orm.relationship(NetworkGatewayDeviceReference, gateway_resource = nvp_networkgw.GATEWAY_RESOURCE_NAME device_resource = nvp_networkgw.DEVICE_RESOURCE_NAME gw_data = network_gateway[self.gateway_resource] # TODO(salv-orlando): Enforce that gateway device identifiers # in this list are among the tenant's NSX network gateway devices # to avoid risk a tenant 'guessing' other tenant's network devices gw_db.devices.extend([NetworkGatewayDeviceReference(**device) gw_data = network_gateway[self.gateway_resource] def _make_gateway_device_dict(self, gateway_device, fields=None): res = {'id': gateway_device['id'], 'name': gateway_device['name'], 'connector_type': gateway_device['connector_type'], 'connector_ip': gateway_device['connector_ip'], 'tenant_id': gateway_device['tenant_id']} return self._fields(res, fields) def _get_gateway_device(self, context, device_id): try: return self._get_by_id(context, NetworkGatewayDevice, device_id) except sa_orm_exc.NoResultFound: raise GatewayDeviceNotFound(device_id=device_id) def _is_device_in_use(self, context, device_id): query = self._get_collection_query( context, NetworkGatewayDeviceReference, {'id': [device_id]}) return query.first() def get_gateway_device(self, context, gateway_device_id, fields=None): return self._make_gateway_device_dict( self._get_gateway_device(context, gateway_device_id), fields) def get_gateway_devices(self, context, filters=None, fields=None): return self._get_collection(context, NetworkGatewayDevice, self._make_gateway_device__dict, filters=filters, fields=fields) def create_gateway_device(self, context, gateway_device_data): device_data = gateway_device_data[self.device_resource] tenant_id = self._get_tenant_id_for_create(context, device_data) with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): device_db = NetworkGatewayDevice( id=device_data.get('id', uuidutils.generate_uuid()), tenant_id=tenant_id, name=device_data.get('name'), connector_type=device_data['connector_type'], connector_ip=device_data['connector_ip']) context.session.add(device_db) LOG.debug(_("Created network gateway device: %s"), device_db['id']) return self._make_gateway_device_dict(device_db) def update_gateway_device(self, context, gateway_device_id, gateway_device_data): device_data = gateway_device_data[self.device_resource] with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): device_db = self._get_gateway_device(context, gateway_device_id) for item in device_data: if item in device_db: device_db[item] = device_data[item] context.session.add(device_db) LOG.debug(_("Updated network gateway device: %s"), gateway_device_id) return self._make_gateway_device_dict(device_db) def delete_gateway_device(self, context, gateway_device_id): with context.session.begin(subtransactions=True): # A gateway device should not be deleted # if it is used in any network gateway service if self._is_device_in_use(context, gateway_device_id): raise GatewayDeviceInUse(device_id=gateway_device_id) device_db = self._get_gateway_device(context, gateway_device_id) context.session.delete(device_db) LOG.debug(_("Deleted network gateway device: %s."), gateway_device_id)
deleted_lines: class NetworkGatewayDevice(model_base.BASEV2): devices = orm.relationship(NetworkGatewayDevice, resource = nvp_networkgw.RESOURCE_NAME.replace('-', '_') gw_data = network_gateway[self.resource] gw_db.devices.extend([NetworkGatewayDevice(**device) gw_data = network_gateway[self.resource]

commit_message:
Makes the Extension loader behavior predictable

When using a cluster of load-balanced Neutron Servers,
the order of extension files being loaded may differ
from one server to another. This is usually harmless,
but it is better to force the list to be loaded in the
same way across the entire cluster, just in case
something funky is going on.

Partial-bug: #1285999

Change-Id: Ib0bfd24fc52b6cd9f90c350d3af496f04a90f50a

commit_message:
heat_keystoneclient don't pass project and trust_id

When creating a keystoneclient connection with a trust, we should
not pass the project_name, as the token can only be scoped to either
a trust or project, not both.  Previous versions of keystoneclient
worked with both, but recent changes mean this no longer works.

Change-Id: I5c7e7498137d428360f2b5f1e8bd2d079c80cd9b
Closes-Bug: #1288223

commit_message:
Refactor vmdk upload code

A syntax error is hit when trying to upload a flat vmdk file that
is accompanied by a descriptor file. The code block that handles
this has some unneeded characters that cause the error. Also,
an else-block has been removed so that we can remove an extra
indent.

Change-Id: Iaf5c914e09da6831eeeec141228b39554a1e2216
Closes-bug: #1288471

If expires is a str then isinstance six.text_type is false then the following

Closes-Bug: #1285871

commit_message:
revocation_list only call isotime on datetime objects

If expires is a str then isinstance six.text_type is false then the following
exception is raised:
AttributeError: 'str' object has no attribute 'strftime'

This change explicitly checks for a datetime object, which is what
timeutils.isotime expects.

Change-Id: I8012f96498fffe5f54e7f1ca08b7beb6fa168f9c
Closes-Bug: #1285871
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/keystone refs/changes/77/76977/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import datetime if expires and isinstance(expires, datetime.datetime):

commit_message:
Iniset keystone auth version

Introduces support for suth_version config flag in lib/tempest.
The variable is named TEMPEST_AUTH_VERSION, and it can be set
via localrc, so that the devstack-vm-gate-wrap may control it.

The aim is to setup a keystone v3 based experimental check
job in tempest experimental pipeline.

Partially implements bp multi-keystone-api-version-tests

Change-Id: Ia6832d87308c6c7109e6ae0dbd8dff61134718ee

commit_message:
NSX: fix nonsensical log trace on update port

Having this at a WARN level makes no sense, especially
because the actually message does not say anything about
a warning condition. Probably a brain fart of some sort.
Make it DEBUG, just because it may come handy to see what
data we're passing.

Change-Id: Ie667018faae587a3adb6b3edda4d9912344cae83

commit_message:
fix DB API user_creds_get for non-existent ID

If you pass a non-existent ID to the user_creds_get call, it throws
an exception "TypeError: 'NoneType' object is not iterable", but it
should probably return None to be consistent with other get methods

Partial-Bug: #1266523
Change-Id: I8887afa04d80b91ff4479c6ede3818da4d67d726

commit_message:
Make user_creds_id a parser.Stack attribute

Expose the user_creds_id column via a stack attribute, like all
the other columns, this avoids loading another stack object from
the DB just to retrieve the id, and also provides a convenient
interface to update the id when required (via Stack.store())

Partial-Bug: #1266523
Change-Id: Id404f9402b24988266acd881d1e775aa3cfee60d

commit_message:
Handle 503 response from Nova API

The stack fails when Nova responds with a 503 during a
create/update/delete.  503 (Service Unavailable) is an intermittent,
non-critical error and should be handled the same way OverLimit and 500
errors are being handled.

Change-Id: Iadc3b39d099fcc7870764b7a42c5edee41c527dc
Closes-Bug: #1289549

subject: ServerCfnInitTestJSON wait for stack complete before ssh

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-06 21:11:41.000000000', 'files': ['tempest/api/orchestration/stacks/test_server_cfn_init.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/tempest/commit/5a9c99bd606c992b1e757d805df10442915c2e74', 'message': 'ServerCfnInitTestJSON wait for stack complete before ssh

ssh connection has a default timeout of 300 seconds but
boot times of ~250 seconds have been observed so this is
failing for a proportion of runs.

This change waits for the entire stack to be in CREATE_COMPLETE
instead of just the server resource. This means the ssh daemon

Closes-Bug: #1288993
'}]
commit_message:
ServerCfnInitTestJSON wait for stack complete before ssh

ssh connection has a default timeout of 300 seconds but
boot times of ~250 seconds have been observed so this is
failing for a proportion of runs.

This change waits for the entire stack to be in CREATE_COMPLETE
instead of just the server resource. This means the ssh daemon
will definitely be running when ssh is attempted.

Change-Id: Iab1c797b456c6bd46283a7348896a79ebc41d7e1
Closes-Bug: #1288993
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/tempest refs/changes/63/78763/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: # wait for server resource create to complete. self.client.wait_for_resource_status(sid, rid, 'CREATE_COMPLETE')

commit_message:
Drop old nvp extension file

The resource alias is unchanged so there is really
no reason of dragging this forward.

If API clients are using the name or the description
in order to play with a server's extension they are
doing it wrong so they deserve the grief caused
by this change.

Change-Id: I99086c11a0e4a0b0af479e0e3d1fbe92f8ff5988
Closes-bug: #1285999

commit_message:
Update oslo-incubator gettextutils module

Changes -
 * Add support for translating log levels separately

Change-Id: I75c058959fcbcc97f5f73aca597a084c6804b71d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/sahara refs/changes/00/78200/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: import functools# We use separate translation catalogs for each log level, so set up a # mapping between the log level name and the translator. The domain # for the log level is project_name + "-log-" + log_level so messages # for each level end up in their own catalog. _t_log_levels = dict( (level, gettext.translation('savanna' + '-log-' + level, localedir=_localedir, fallback=True)) for level in ['info', 'warning', 'error', 'critical'] ) def _log_translation(msg, level): """Build a single translation of a log message """ if USE_LAZY: return Message(msg, domain='savanna' + '-log-' + level) else: translator = _t_log_levels[level] if six.PY3: return translator.gettext(msg) return translator.ugettext(msg) # Translators for log levels. # # The abbreviated names are meant to reflect the usual use of a short # name like '_'. The "L" is for "log" and the other letter comes from # the level. _LI = functools.partial(_log_translation, level='info') _LW = functools.partial(_log_translation, level='warning') _LE = functools.partial(_log_translation, level='error') _LC = functools.partial(_log_translation, level='critical')

Make the get_all functional tests assume less of the db state

Don't assume the table is empty
Add an entry and make sure we can find it.

commit_message:
copy over swift.authorize stuff into subrequests

If auth is setup in the env then it needs to be copied over with the
make_request wsgi helper.  Also renamed make_request to
make_subrequest- when I grepped for make_request I got > 250 results,
this'll make it easier to find references to this function in the
future.

Updated docs and sample confs to show tempurl needs to be before dlo and
slo as well as auth.

Change-Id: I9750555727f520a7c9fedd5f4fd31ff0f63d8088

commit_message:
Remove compute API get_instance_bdms method

This method is just an unnecessary level of indirecton, now that we have
BDM objects that give us a nice API on top of db calls, so we can remove
it,

Part of blueprint: icehouse-objects
Part of blueprint: clean-up-legacy-block-device-mapping

Change-Id: I02226cfb67955b604d6bed513211ef46fb65dc69
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/41/72341/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
deleted_lines: def _setup_get_instance_bdm_mox(self): new_bdm = object() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(self.compute_api.db, 'block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance') self.compute_api.db.\ block_device_mapping_get_all_by_instance( mox.IgnoreArg(), mox.IgnoreArg()).AndReturn(new_bdm) return new_bdm def test_get_instance_bdms_legacy(self): expected = self._setup_get_instance_bdm_mox() self.mox.ReplayAll() instance = {'uuid': 'fake-instance'} self.assertEqual(expected, self.compute_api.get_instance_bdms({}, instance, legacy=False)) def test_get_instance_bdms_default(self): new_bdm = self._setup_get_instance_bdm_mox() expected = legacy_bdm = object() self.mox.StubOutWithMock(block_device, 'legacy_mapping') block_device.legacy_mapping(new_bdm).AndReturn(legacy_bdm) self.mox.ReplayAll() instance = {'uuid': 'fake-instance'} self.assertEqual(expected, self.compute_api.get_instance_bdms({}, instance))

commit_message:
VMware: boot from iso support

The code enables the VMware driver to boot from an ISO
image.

Implements blueprint vmware-iso-boot

Change-Id: I568df99d6530f898d5a1885256604cf050b33dba

commit_message:
Add libvirt_inject_key attribute

This change makes nova setting libvirt_inject_key configurable,
defaulting to the OpenStack default (true).

Change-Id: Ie890666714d5857a8a88a17faf2c68ca775837e2

commit_message:
Add excutils and timeutils to openstack/common

These additions are to support cli integration tests
which need to track time and report exceptions in test results.

Partial-implements: blueprint cli-integration-tests
Change-Id: I4166ad18c2fadf565504c90e9cdec0a4ae34f2f8

commit_message:
Remove unused method from timeutils

Marconi no longer uses set_time_override. Therefore there is no need to
invoke clear_time_override anymore.

Change-Id: Ifa5c6ab958130b2edbce57780fe6462ebfc37409
Related-Bug: #1266962

commit_message:
Move run_instance compute to BDM objects

This patch moves the run_instance code of the compute service to BDM
objects.

This is the last bit of compute that needed migrating to BDM objects.

Part of blueprint: icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I055651b5fd415092787d9487a69467a9bbcf073e
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/79/71479/18 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: *block_device_lists): dev_list = [bdm.device_name if bdm.device_name] dev = bdm.device_name bdm.device_name = dev bdm.save()
deleted_lines: update_function, *block_device_lists): dev_list = [bdm['device_name'] if bdm['device_name']] dev = bdm.get('device_name') bdm['device_name'] = dev if update_function: update_function(bdm)

subject: Move live migration callbacks to BDM objects
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-02-04 19:04:06.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/fe279239f0a5c0ecea97f6212606c5a076f8c436', 'message': 'Move live migration callbacks to BDM objects

This patch moves the two live migration callbacks _post_live_migration
and _rollback_live_migration to use BDM objects.

As this is the last code that was using _get_instance_volume_bdms helper
method, this patch removes it.

Part of blueprint: icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I904d8b5b58d0ee4ba5a5d836fe3f8a236793f33b
'}, {'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-06 10:22:59.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/nova/commit/a74312c4fcd8322c021d3697c07b0a7248fa54fc', 'message': 'Move live migration callbacks to BDM objects

This patch moves the two live migration callbacks _post_live_migration
and _rollback_live_migration to use BDM objects.

As this is the last code that was using _get_instance_volume_bdms helper
method, this patch removes it.

commit_message:
Move live migration callbacks to BDM objects

This patch moves the two live migration callbacks _post_live_migration
and _rollback_live_migration to use BDM objects.

As this is the last code that was using _get_instance_volume_bdms helper
method, this patch removes it.

Part of blueprint: icehouse-objects

Change-Id: I904d8b5b58d0ee4ba5a5d836fe3f8a236793f33b

Volume backup details API test

This patch adds volume_backup_details vlolume API Test.
It also changes assertEqual() function to correct one, where
first parameter will be expected and other is actual.

Sphinx's config object needs to have its values initialized with
init_values for the values to be loaded from _raw_config into config.
Without this pbr gets null equivalent values from Sphinx's config. These

Change-Id: I0f17ca6eff036a0bcc6686fcc3f4efe0830cc585
"}]
commit_message:
Init sphinx config values before accessing them.

Sphinx's config object needs to have its values initialized with
init_values for the values to be loaded from _raw_config into config.
Without this pbr gets null equivalent values from Sphinx's config. These
null values prevented man pages from being built when Sphinx warnerrors
is set. Fix this.

Change-Id: I0f17ca6eff036a0bcc6686fcc3f4efe0830cc585
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/pbr refs/changes/21/78821/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

added_lines: Fuel updates the ``/etc/init.d/rabbitmq-server`` init scripts for CentOS and Ubuntu to customized versions. These scripts attempt to start RabbitMQ twice, giving the RabbitMQ master node the necessary time to start after complete power loss. With the scripts in place, power up all nodes, then check to see whether the RabbitMQ server started on all nodes. All nodes should start automatically.
deleted_lines: Fuel updates the ``/etc/init.d/rabbitmq-server`` init scripts for RHEL/Centos to customized versions. These scripts attempt to start RabbitMQ twice, giving the RabbitMQ master node the necessary time to start after complete power loss. With the scripts in place, power up all nodes, then check to see whether the RabbitMQ server started on all nodes. All nodes should start automatically.

commit_message:
remove keypair from secgroup context

The keypair part would be put into another context. And when setuping
secgroup, this patch would create sec-group for every tenant instead of
every user.

Change-Id: I5ae1039ceafb49ac70e6439d0a23ba4a36975385

deleted_lines: secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') @mock.patch('rally.benchmark.context.secgroup.osclients.Clients') def test_prep_ssh_keypairs(self, mock_osclients): fake_nova = fakes.FakeNovaClient() self.assertEqual(len(fake_nova.keypairs.list()), 0) mock_cl = mock.MagicMock() mock_cl.get_nova_client.return_value = fake_nova mock_osclients.return_value = mock_cl secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') self.assertEqual(len(fake_nova.keypairs.list()), 1) self.assertTrue( 'rally_ssh_key' in [sg.name for sg in fake_nova.keypairs.list()] ) # run prep again, check that another keypair is not created secgroup._prepare_for_instance_ssh('endpoint') self.assertEqual(len(fake_nova.keypairs.list()), 1)

commit_message:
Add QA section for HA architecture considerations.

other MySQL notes:
- Added comments about multi-master writes support
- Added clarification on active/backup roles provided by HAProxy

Add section for Ceph

Closes-bug: #1270840

Change-Id: Ib6649abed76668cb85e0d7594981a22bfc3e833d
Signed-off-by: Bogdan Dobrelya <bdobrelia@mirantis.com>
Signed-off-by: Andrew Woodward <awoodward@mirantis.com>
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/98/72298/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: 2. **[Q]** MySQL with Galera - is it an active/active HA? Does it support multi-master writes? I was told/tend to think "yes", but want to understand it better. A simple workflow example would help. **[A]** Yes, MySQL+Galera is true master-master solution. While it is possible and, in case of 6+ nodes even recommended, to set 1-2 Galera nodes as slaves - for additional data consistency. Previous Fuel versions used HAProxy as MySQL managing solution. In case of Mirantis OpenStack (starting from 3.0 or 3.1) MySQL+Galera cluster is managed by Pacemaker and HAProxy which provides aVirtual IP address (VIP) for MySQL backend, thus multi-master writes are not supported as well as Openstack configuration (connection=...) does not support it yet. HAProxy provides 1 node as an 'active' one and others as a 'backup'. There is no single master node in Galera cluster though - there are nodes with most recent data replica and nodes which still have to sync with this recent replica. Workflow is simple. Node serves new data changing request via its VIP and increases its UUID number. And the rest of the nodes must synchronize the data from the nodes with UUID greater than current. 3. **[Q]** Ceph-MON on controllers - is it an active/active HA? **[A]** Yes, CEPH monitors are also master-master. One of them is periodically becomes a leader. Leader is the node, which got the most recent cluster map replica first. Other monitor nodes must sync they cluster map with current leader. Every monitor node already synced with leader becomes provider and leader knows which nodes are currently providers. So, leader also tells the other nodes which provider each of them should use to get data from. CEPH monitor synchronization algorithm works similar way as Galera, but CEPH nodes are parted by functionality to monitor nodes and data storage nodes. In turn, every Galera node has all the same service set on each node. So, CEPH monitor nodes only manage where the data should be actually stored and maintain data consistency between OSD nodes. 4. **[Q]** Neutron - is it in active/standy HA? I got this understanding from docs and want to understand why. I was told that Grizzly and Havanna support multiple l3 agents, but we don't leverage it on some reason in Fuel. **[A]** Additionally to the previous answerers it should be added that Neutron is a router among the other functionality. It is the reason why there is a single entry point.

subject: Speed up failing InternalClient requests
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-05 02:43:02.000000000', 'files': ['swift/common/internal_client.py'], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/swift/commit/2ed5a4ae86fdb9e1970e081c14f463b7a72b166a', 'message': "Speed up failing InternalClient requests

InternalClient.make_request was sleeping after every attempt,
including the last one. We don't need to sleep after the final

Change-Id: Ieee5f96afb5b39a659d8438a237bfd907405165a
"}]
commit_message:
Speed up failing InternalClient requests

InternalClient.make_request was sleeping after every attempt,
including the last one. We don't need to sleep after the final
attempt; we can just return failure.

Change-Id: Ieee5f96afb5b39a659d8438a237bfd907405165a
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/swift refs/changes/70/78070/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # sleep only between tries, not after each one if attempt < self.request_tries - 1: sleep(2 ** (attempt + 1))

commit_message:
Fixes issues in devstack Ironic setup

Fixes a number of issues in proposed review #70348:

 * Adds package requirements to filse/apts/ironic
 * Updates IRONIC_* to make use of DATA_DIR/ironic for storing
   runtime resources
 * Moves tftpboot directory, ssh keys, MACs CSV to DATA_DIR/ironic
 * Adds STACK_USER to libvirt group and runs setup scripts
   in a new shell to ensure group membership is applied
 * On Ubuntu, installs linux headers packages with any DKMS package
   (openvswitch in this case)
 * Makes VM and network setup scripts a bit more robust and avoids
   silent errors
 * Cleans up created libvirt resources during unstack

Change-Id: Ib8c858bfe1345978528d1d03cadb5304e968291c
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/34/78834/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

subject: Fixes the EC2 Auth Token Settings
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-07 16:44:07.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat/commit/0d48903d7e8958e8bf1edf04c3e3a9e7610de66e', 'message': 'Fixes the EC2 Auth Token Settings

Previously, the module would create a keystone_ec2_uri parameter
in heat.conf.  This flag does not exist within heat.conf.
Additionally, the auth_uri within [ec2authtoken] would use the
incorrect auth uri (standard Keystone URL instead of the EC2
URI).

Conflicts:

        spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb

Change-Id: I61bcf59c60617db07eb3fad3e3e23e8fd6ab9eff

commit_message:
Fixes the EC2 Auth Token Settings

Previously, the module would create a keystone_ec2_uri parameter
in heat.conf.  This flag does not exist within heat.conf.
Additionally, the auth_uri within [ec2authtoken] would use the
incorrect auth uri (standard Keystone URL instead of the EC2
URI).

Conflicts:

        spec/classes/heat_init_spec.rb

Change-Id: I61bcf59c60617db07eb3fad3e3e23e8fd6ab9eff
(cherry picked from commit 768a4e593e6db8b7948623b9eb3ae840a9ef4ab4)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/puppet-heat refs/changes/06/79006/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: :keystone_ec2_uri => 'http://127.0.0.1:5000/v2.0/ec2tokens', it 'configures keystone_ec2_uri' do should contain_heat_config('ec2authtoken/auth_uri').with_value( params[:keystone_ec2_uri] ) end shared_examples_for 'with ec2authtoken auth uri set' do before do params.merge!( :keystone_ec2_uri => 'http://1.2.3.4:35357/v2.0/ec2tokens' ) end it do should contain_heat_config('ec2authtoken/auth_uri').with_value('http://1.2.3.4:35357/v2.0/ec2tokens') end end

commit_message:
Make the functional tests cleanup after themselves

The tests can fail or pass the first time, but fail in repeated
runs as the same db is used and the get_all test assume an empty
table. So start off with trying to cleanup.

Change-Id: I97937d9b33edc760dc7f3c6d4eb9e2f678506bbc

commit_message:
Update marconi.conf-sample to deprecate sqlite

Now we're supporting sqlalchemy and the sqlite is deprecated.
So the marconi.conf-sample should be update to reflect the
change so as to avoid confusion.

Closes-Bug: #1288619

Change-Id: Ief5dad6345dc24e70af18e9e47d0f8dd384cee47

commit_message:
Slighty refactored url_prefix usage in WSGI tests

Several calls to url_prefix has been replaced
with the usage of a common variable in WSGI tests
in order to adjust to DRY principles.

Change-Id: I056e1e8879a97f6a30aff924e55bdf50897c08e4
Closes-Bug: #1285219

commit_message:
Add os-server-external-events support

This adds support for the os-server-external-events extension in nova,
which allows other services to deliver events to nova.

It also adds a shell command to trigger the "network-changed" event
manually, which will cause nova to refresh its network cache from
neutron.

Related to blueprint admin-event-callback-api

Change-Id: I1a302a43b6b7a6d8bdc03965a8f4c1a151bcab88
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/python-novaclient refs/changes/63/74763/13 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # Copyright (C) 2014, Red Hat, Inc. # # Licensed under the Apache License, Version 2.0 (the "License"); you may # not use this file except in compliance with the License. You may obtain # a copy of the License at # # http://www.apache.org/licenses/LICENSE-2.0 # # Unless required by applicable law or agreed to in writing, software # distributed under the License is distributed on an "AS IS" BASIS, WITHOUT # WARRANTIES OR CONDITIONS OF ANY KIND, either express or implied. See the # License for the specific language governing permissions and limitations # under the License. """ External event triggering for servers, not to be used by users. """ from novaclient import base class Event(base.Resource): def __repr__(self): return "<Event: %s>" % self.name class ServerExternalEventManager(base.Manager): resource_class = Event def create(self, server_uuid, event_name, event_tag=None): body = {'event': {'instance_uuid': server_uuid, 'name': event_name}} if event_tag: body['event']['tag'] = event_tag return self._create('/os-instance-external-events', body, 'event') manager_class = ServerExternalEventManager name = 'server_external_events'

Enable shards test for sqlalchemy

catalogue, so this patch will enable the shards test for
sqlalchemy.

Closes-Bug: #1288148

commit_message:
Modifying the doc to include maven installation instructions from it's own website

Change-Id: Iefb04e4141c88e365cd0dd3c419906e2e649071d
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/openstack-manuals refs/changes/27/79027/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: <para>Extract the distribution archive to the directory you wish to install Maven. A subdirectory <filename>apache-maven-x.x.x</filename> will be created from the archive ("x.x.x" is your maven version):</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>cd /usr/local/apache-maven/</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo tar -xvzf apache-maven-x.x.x-bin.tar.gz</userinput> </screen> <para>Add the M2_HOME environment variable</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>export M2_HOME=/usr/local/apache-maven/apache-maven-x.x.x</userinput> </screen> <para>Add the M2 environment variable</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>export M2=$M2_HOME/bin</userinput> </screen> <para>Optional: Add the MAVEN_OPTS environment variable to specify JVM properties. This environment variable can be used to supply extra options to Maven.</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>export MAVEN_OPTS='-Xms256m -XX:MaxPermSize=1024m -Xmx1024m'</userinput> </screen> </step> <step> <para>Add M2 environment variable to your path</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>export PATH=$M2:$PATH</userinput> </screen> </step> <step> <para>Make sure that JAVA_HOME is set to the location of your JDK and that $JAVA_HOME/bin is in your PATH environment variable.</para> </step> <step> <para>Run mvn to verify that it is correctly installed.</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>mvn --version</userinput> </screen>
deleted_lines: <para>Install maven:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo /usr/local/apache-maven/XXXXX</userinput></screen> <para>Add the maven path:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo touch /etc/path.d/mvn.path</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo vi /etc/path.d/mvn.path</userinput> <prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>/usr/local/apache-maven/apache-maven-3.0.5/bin</userinput></screen> <para>Define your maven user profile settings:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> export MAVEN_OPTS='-Xms256m -XX:MaxPermSize=1024m -Xmx1024m'</screen> <para>Verify that maven is set up correctly:</para> <screen><prompt>$</prompt> <userinput>sudo mvn --install</userinput></screen>

commit_message:
Improve help strings

Improve consistency of help strings:
* Add "." at end of help strings and descriptions.
* Improve descriptions.
* Fix capitalization.

Change-Id: I291acea95871734a30192c2e4564267326f9c0a7

commit_message:
Nuage plugin was missed in floatingip_status db migration script

The fix for bug 1287630 did not include the the Nuage plugin
in those affected by the migration.
Nuage CI started failing floatingip tests since than
reporting unknown column error.
This bug fix is to add nuage plugin to the list.

Change-Id: I7133fc97d65618549f72d7649232002cbb640bbb
Closes-bug: 1288929

commit_message:
Fix link for training-cluster-scripts

Currently we link to a copy of the scripts on docs.openstack.org - and
that location does not exist.

Instead of putting this data on docs.openstack.org, let's give a
reference to github and distribute it from there.

Change-Id: I4dc7f31a3a50520ccef16db7e4ff0b54d02d89ff
Closes-Bug: #1282874

commit_message:
Applied naming conventions to Keystone service descriptions

After noticing some inconsistency among Keystone service
descriptions, I applied the naming conventions defined here:

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Documentation/Conventions

Change-Id: Iace29f5fa4d29f93104f34da780d42f6d2f62d8f
Closes-Bug: #1287958

commit_message:
Removed *.ini configuration steps from Nova compute section

Nova in Icehouse doesn't seem to require configuration of *.ini files,
particularly the [filter:authtoken] section. I removed these steps
from the compute section of the Nova chapter. I also added the
'auth_uri' key to the [keystone_authtoken] section in nova.conf.

Change-Id: I2c2e75f1855752a68fec2686a9ff639bef97eacd
Closes-Bug: #1287900

added_lines: <prompt>#</prompt> <userinput>openstack-config --set /etc/nova/nova.conf keystone_authtoken auth_uri http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000</userinput>connection = mysql://nova:NOVA_DBPASS@controller/nova [keystone_authtoken] auth_uri = http://<replaceable>controller</replaceable>:5000 auth_host = <replaceable>controller</replaceable> auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = http admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = nova admin_password = <replaceable>NOVA_PASS</replaceable></programlisting> <note> <para>Ensure that the <option>api_paste_config=/etc/nova/api-paste.ini</option> option is set in <filename>/etc/nova/nova.conf</filename> file.</para> </note>
deleted_lines: connection = mysql://nova:NOVA_DBPASS@controller/nova</programlisting> <para>Edit the <filename>/etc/nova/api-paste.ini</filename> file to add the credentials to the <literal>[filter:authtoken]</literal> section:</para> <note><title>Use of .ini files</title> <para>Files with the extension <filename>.ini</filename> sometimes need to be edited during initial setup. However, they should not be used for general configuration tasks.</para> </note> <programlisting language="ini">[filter:authtoken] paste.filter_factory = keystoneclient.middleware.auth_token:filter_factory auth_host = <replaceable>controller</replaceable> auth_port = 35357 auth_protocol = http admin_tenant_name = service admin_user = nova admin_password = <replaceable>NOVA_PASS</replaceable> </programlisting> <note os="fedora;rhel;centos;opensuse;sles"> <para>Ensure that the <option>api_paste_config=/etc/nova/api-paste.ini</option> option is set in <filename>/etc/nova/nova.conf</filename> file.</para> </note> </step> <step>

commit_message:
Decrypt and display VM generated password

Add optional Retrieve Password action on instance that allows users
to decrypt, on client side, the password generated for the Admin
session.

Change-Id: I37cc93ae7871bf78e90513f58e169883fbfd1621
Implements: blueprint decrypt-and-display-vm-generated-password

commit_message:
Fake logger as instance attribute

Fake logger returned by fixtures.FakeLogger must be BaseTestCase instance
attribute. Suchwise fake logger is accesible in BaseTestCase subclasses.

Closes-Bug: #1289403
Change-Id: I44afc23483f3bf0f031ba15d7f88e83b8be6f413

commit_message:
Fix HOT set_stack_id

HOTParameters.set_stack_id didn't return True in case of success, which
made the stack prints a spurious warning about not being able to set
StackId.

Change-Id: If8dc76a8588f730fd184abdab0be28e60a34fa99

commit_message:
Delay creating mongo replica set until other broker hosts available

MongoDB requires all members of the replica set be up when
initiating the replica set. This change delays the creation of
the rs until the other brokers have had a chance to reboot. The
openshift.sh script is used by setting the CONF_ACTIONS env var.

Change-Id: I2153ca07d3140cdd74ec3d90a4a61f6c41ddffa8

commit_message:
Fix parameter constraints syntax

The server flavor constraints were removed since custom flavors
may be defined that are outside the list of default flavors.

Change-Id: Ifa3d5791257a60a2462cdd4d0d5b53a6721bd50e

deleted_lines: allowed_values: [m1.small, m1.medium, m1.large, m1.xlarge] constraint_description: Must be a valid server flavor allowed_Values: [yum, rhsm, rhn] allowed_values: ["1.2", "2.0"]

commit_message:
Tighten up security group port settings for broker and node.

Separate security groups were created for broker and node hosts.
Firewall rules follow documentation:
https://access.redhat.com/site/documentation/en-US/OpenShift_Enterprise\
/2/html/Deployment_Guide/Network_Access.html

Change-Id: If54f9b636e13679372bd566c8cc8dc6a08e4c7d2

commit_message:
README documentation updates

Change-Id: Iba0de05caea7a1f0a8055a6139ad3ecaaaa662cd
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/heat-templates refs/changes/79/77779/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: * Neutron networking: one private and one public network * `heat resource-list openshift-ha-stack` 6. Additional configuration: heat stack-create openshift-node -f ose_node_stack.yaml -e ose_node_env.yaml -P "node_hostname=node4" 3. On broker1 add a DNS record for the new node server in `/var/named/dynamic/<my_domain>.db`. To force a zone transfer to the upstream DNS increment the serial number by 1 and run `rndc freeze ; rndc thaw`. neutron lb-member-create --address <broker1_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_lb_pool neutron lb-member-create --address <broker2_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_lb_pool neutron lb-member-create --address <broker3_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_lb_pool 2. Add session persistence to LBaaS virtual IP (VIP): neutron lb-vip-update ose_broker_vip --session-persistence type=dict type='SOURCE_IP'4. Create districts. The following creates a small district and adds two nodes to the district. oo-admin-ctl-district -c create -n small_district -p small oo-admin-ctl-district -c add-node -n small_district -i <node1_hostname> oo-admin-ctl-district -c add-node -n small_district -i <node2_hostname>
deleted_lines: * `heat event-list openshift-ha-stack` 6. Possible additional steps depending on order resources are created: * Confirm MongoDB replica set is created. If needed, create openshift_broker user and replica set. # mongo > rs.initiate() PRIMARY> rs.add("broker2.example.com:27017") { "ok" : 1 } PRIMARY> rs.add("broker3.example.com:27017") { "ok" : 1 } PRIMARY> rs.status() ... PRIMARY> exit # mongo openshift_broker --eval 'db.addUser("openshift", "<mongopass>")' # mongo PRIMARY> show dbs admin (empty) local 1.06201171875GB openshift_broker 0.0625GB heat stack-create openshift-node -f ose_node_stack.yaml -e ose_node_env.yaml -P "NodeHostname=node4" 3. On broker1 add a DNS record for the new node server in `/var/named/dynamic/<my_domain>.db` and restart named, `service named restart`. To force a zone transfer to the upstream DNS be sure to increment the serial number by 1 and run `rndc freeze ; rndc thaw`. neutron lb-member-create --address <broker1_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_pool neutron lb-member-create --address <broker2_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_pool neutron lb-member-create --address <broker3_fixed_ip> --protocol-port 443 ose_broker_pool 2. Create districts. The following creates a small district and adds two nodes to the district. oo-admin-ctl-district -c create -n small_district -p small oo-admin-ctl-district -c add-node -n small_district -i <node1_hostname> oo-admin-ctl-district -c add-node -n small_district -i <node2_hostname>

Change-Id: I696e7c7fe63c835f90c56105775def305a702877
'}, {'number': 8, 'created': '2014-03-01 03:41:11.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/afecde52cc41eb8b65243863bf989103c1ad8fda', 'message': 'Add support for configuring OVS to work with OpenDaylight

This adds support for enabling OpenDaylight in devstack. This first
cut simply allows you to "enable_service opendaylight", in which case
this will trigger the configuration of OVS on the host to point both
it's OVSDB and per-bridge OpenFlow connections at the OpenDaylight
controller.

Future patches will enable OpenDaylight to be run under devstack.

Closes-bug: #1273917

Change-Id: I696e7c7fe63c835f90c56105775def305a702877
'}, {'number': 9, 'created': '2014-03-02 01:12:24.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/fb3137b6454aa49bf2e1a6ba2bacad0fe1d27705', 'message': 'Add support for configuring OVS to work with OpenDaylight

This adds support for enabling OpenDaylight in devstack. This first
cut simply allows you to "enable_service opendaylight", in which case
this will trigger the configuration of OVS on the host to point both
it's OVSDB and per-bridge OpenFlow connections at the OpenDaylight
controller.

Future patches will enable OpenDaylight to be run under devstack.

Closes-bug: #1273917

Change-Id: I696e7c7fe63c835f90c56105775def305a702877
'}, {'number': 10, 'created': '2014-03-03 18:16:52.000000000', 'files': [], 'web_link': 'https://opendev.org/openstack/devstack/commit/18d3b7174262e9f58f22779a397483d8847a2565', 'message': 'Add support for configuring OVS to work with OpenDaylight

This adds support for running OpenDaylight as an OpenStack Neutron plugin
under devstack. This entails downloading the latest version of OpenDaylight,
configuring it, and running it as a service under devstack. This code also
includes pieces which configure Open vSwitch on each devstack node to point
at OpenDaylight as their OpenFlow and OVSDB control interface. This is
required for compute hosts, which will not be running any Neutron software
on them at all. This post-devstack configuration is handled in the extras
directory because of the fact there is no Neutron code running on the compute
hosts themselves.

Closes-bug: #1273917

Change-Id: I696e7c7fe63c835f90c56105775def305a702877

commit_message:
Add support for configuring OVS to work with OpenDaylight

This adds support for running OpenDaylight as an OpenStack Neutron plugin
under devstack. This entails downloading the latest version of OpenDaylight,
configuring it, and running it as a service under devstack. This code also
includes pieces which configure Open vSwitch on each devstack node to point
at OpenDaylight as their OpenFlow and OVSDB control interface. This is
required for compute hosts, which will not be running any Neutron software
on them at all. This post-devstack configuration is handled in the extras
directory because of the fact there is no Neutron code running on the compute
hosts themselves.

Closes-bug: #1273917

Change-Id: I696e7c7fe63c835f90c56105775def305a702877
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/74/69774/17 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: # opendaylight.sh - DevStack extras script ODL_FOUND=$(echo $Q_ML2_PLUGIN_MECHANISM_DRIVERS | grep -q opendaylight ; echo $?) if [ "$ODL_FOUND" == "0" ] ; then if [[ "$1" == "source" ]]; then # Initial source source $TOP_DIR/lib/neutron elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "install" ]]; then # no-op : elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "post-config" ]]; then # OpenDaylight configuration comes after all services are up : elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "extra" ]]; then echo_summary "Initializing OpenDaylight" if [ "$ODL_LOCAL_IP" == "" ]; then ODL_LOCAL_IP=$HOST_IP fi if [ "$ODL_MGR_IP" == "" ]; then read ovstbl <<< $(sudo ovs-vsctl get Open_vSwitch . _uuid) ODL_MGR_IP=$(grep url /$Q_PLUGIN_CONF_FILE | sed -e s'/.*\/\///'g -e 's/\:.*//'g) fi if [ "$ODL_MGR_PORT" == "" ]; then ODL_MGR_PORT=6640 fi sudo ovs-vsctl set-manager tcp:$ODL_MGR_IP:$ODL_MGR_PORT sudo ovs-vsctl set Open_vSwitch $ovstbl other_config={"local_ip"="$ODL_LOCAL_IP"} elif [[ "$1" == "stack" && "$2" == "post-extra" ]]; then # no-op : fi if [[ "$1" == "unstack" ]]; then sudo ovs-vsctl del-manager BRIDGES=$(sudo ovs-vsctl list-br) for bridge in $BRIDGES ; do sudo ovs-vsctl del-controller $bridge done fi if [[ "$1" == "clean" ]]; then # no-op : fi fi

commit_message:
Provide full support for all repository sources

The openshift.sh installer provides support for RHN, RHSM and local
yum repositories. This patch provides mappings to env vars for
all the various options.

Change-Id: I8e1b27562d7800a07220e41a0d17459f0f44877c

commit_message:
Add add_policies and delete_policy to InstanceGroup object

There is a db API method that safely adds a list of policies to an
instance using a db session. Expose it via the InstanceGroup object.
The same holds for the deletion of a specific policy.

Part of blueprint instance-group-api-extension

Change-Id: I57805611b7319fa5faeed5b8655fc293baa12232
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/nova refs/changes/59/78559/3 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: def test_add_policies(self): policies = ['fake1', 'fake2'] values = self._get_default_values() group = self._create_instance_group(self.context, values) policies = instance_group.InstanceGroup.add_policies(self.context, group.uuid, policies) group = instance_group.InstanceGroup.get_by_uuid(self.context, group.uuid) for policy in policies: self.assertIn(policy, policies) self.assertIn(policy, group.policies) def test_delete_policy(self): policies = ['fake1', 'fake2'] values = self._get_default_values() group = self._create_instance_group(self.context, values, policies=policies) for policy in policies: instance_group.InstanceGroup.delete_policies(self.context, group.uuid, policy) group = instance_group.InstanceGroup.get_by_uuid(self.context, group.uuid) self.assertEqual([], group.policies)

commit_message:
Fix a version numbering typo in release notes

Ephemeral RBD backend for Nova was enabled since v4.0, and had a Ceph
SEGV issue in v4.0. This feature in v4.1 no longer has the SEGV problem.

Change-Id: Ia443520260c671cfc60c3223a15225e4ade972e5
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/fuel-docs refs/changes/37/79037/1 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

deleted_lines: In Mirantis OpenStack 4.1,to support VM instances backed by ephemeral volumes stored in Ceph, with Glance, Cinder, and Nova all supporting the Ceph RBD backend.and shared among Compute nodes to enable a live migration of VMs. In Mirantis OpenStack 4.1

commit_message:
Git url validation

* Reads validation rules from Oslo Config 'validate' group
* Checks url max length and regex for security
* Adds a new InvalidInput exception for these kinds of checks

Partially implements: blueprint solum-input-validation
https://blueprints.launchpad.net/solum/+spec/solum-input-validation

Change-Id: Ic39bb419036ac3cf095245296386c3f64a40cabb
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/solum refs/changes/07/79007/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD

commit_message:
Using '0' instead of '-' in overview page.

When there is no data in the project, Usage Summary in overview page
always show '-' for `Active Instances` and other values, it would be
better showing '0' instead '-'.

Change-Id: I121de36ac9dc5ced2218c08b82a8b2e4a3d5e459
Closes-bug: 1288015

commit_message:
Sync log.py from oslo

This change syncs log.py from oslo-incubator with the
following commit:
* Backport 'ident' from python 3.3 for Oslo's SysLogHandler
  79e8a9a08daf563aa8a8d9280c9a6a27dcafc8f2
* default connectionpool to WARN log level:
  1978114030c275c571a1786644a5e0d51ada29c0
* Fix deprecated messages sent multiple times
  52b64466177b58c8e80bc72c5ce1e940782c969a
* Remove None for dict.get()
  86707cd5c01a2de6b9ba386d7ea4f72c9c7286b1
* Rename Openstack to OpenStack
  61ff7a66fef51ba2a783a5ed87e14256a6e9432c
* Use ContextFormatter for imparting context info
  dda47c9cef19c5d8f050cf5081535b4061024457

Change-Id: I14c3d7eccc596783e380ebd57110337d3ce49038
Closes-bug: 904307

The old format ' 'without APP-NAME is deprecated in I, ' 'and will be removed in J.'),class RFCSysLogHandler(logging.handlers.SysLogHandler): def __init__(self, *args, **kwargs): self.binary_name = _get_binary_name() super(RFCSysLogHandler, self).__init__(*args, **kwargs) def format(self, record): msg = super(RFCSysLogHandler, self).format(record) msg = self.binary_name + ' ' + msg return msg # TODO(bogdando) use the format provided by RFCSysLogHandler # after existing syslog format deprecation in J if CONF.use_syslog_rfc_format: syslog = RFCSysLogHandler(address='/dev/log', facility=facility) else: syslog = logging.handlers.SysLogHandler(address='/dev/log', facility=facility)

commit_message:
Explicily enable the stores used by devstack

Devstack currently relies on the default value of the `known_stores`
configuration option. This patch enables explicitly the default stores
used by devstack.

The real fix for the issue below will land in Glance. However, since the
default stores will be FS and HTTP we need devstack to enable Swift's as
well, which is required in the gates, hence this patch.

Partial-Bug: #1255556
Change-Id: Id9aab356b36b2150312324a0349d120bbbbd4e63
(cherry picked from commit 355fc866833e0bd83796da1c45e4f94b58d5f500)
git_command: git fetch https://review.opendev.org/openstack/devstack refs/changes/27/75827/2 && git format-patch -1 --stdout FETCH_HEAD
added_lines: iniset $GLANCE_API_CONF DEFAULT known_stores "glance.store.filesystem.Store, glance.store.http.Store, glance.store.swift.Store"

Fix issue with documentation for Murano OSTF tests

added_lines: To prepare Murano for Windows-based services deployment testing: To prepare Murano for Linux-based services deployment testing: 1. Create a Linux image with Murano agent.2. Upload the image to the OpenStack Image Service (Glance) into the 'admin' tenant. 3. In the OpenStack Dashboard, click the 'Project' tab. 4. Switch to admin tenant if needed. 5. Open 'Murano' tab. 6. Click the 'Images' menu. 7. Click 'Mark Image'. The Image registration window displays. 8. Select the Linux image with Murano Agent. 9. In the 'Title' field, set title for this image. 10. Select the 'Generic Linux' type. 11. Click 'Mark'.
deleted_lines: * Check Default Key Pair 'murano-lb-key' For Server Farms * Check Windows Image With Murano TagTo prepare Murano for testing:12. Create a Linux image with Murano agent.13. Upload the image to the OpenStack Image Service (Glance) into the 'admin' tenant. 14. Open 'Murano' tab. 15. Click the 'Images' menu. 16. Click 'Mark Image'. The Image registration window displays. 17. Select the Linux image with Murano Agent. 18. In the 'Title' field, set title for this image. 19. Select the 'Generic Linux' type. 20. Click 'Mark'.
